description: While this wine has the richness and warmth of its vintage, it also has a fine, dusty, tannic structure, which gives it a serious aspect. Ripe black-plum and berry flavors provide a generous feel, while the crisp acidity offsets the ripeness.
title: Château Chantemerle 2009  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A rich, bold wine full of wood flavors that are already well integrated with the ripe fruit and solid tannins. The wine is dense, while having a surface polish of smooth fruitiness. Give the wine 3-5 years.
title: Château La Roche Bazin 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a wine with potential. It has weight and ripe berry fruits balanced with solid tannins and a dense texture. Behind the structure, the fruit and acidity promise good things. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Camelot la Chapelle 2011  Bordeaux

description: In this rich wine, powerful, spicy tannins and a solid structure pair well with the black fruits. It shows the density of the vintage as well as its potential. Drink this structured wine from 2022.
title: Château Joinin 2016  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and spicy, balancing tannins with dark fruits, this wine has excellent potential. It is solid and concentrated. Tannins from the wood and from the black fruitsÂ have come together well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Bolaire 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Powerful, rich and dense, this has tannins and fruit that share the same generosity and ripeness. The wood influence provides a caramel character at the back of the sweet-tasting fruit notes. Age for 4-5 years.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This rich wine is full of ripe fruits and some firm tannins that are already integrated. Full, warm and spicy, it has excellent potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Vieux Manoir 2016  Bordeaux

description: This rich, juicy wine offers swathes of black fruit and balanced, firm tannins. Still very young, it is structured and dense, packed with blackberry flavors with a concentrated, dark aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Lary 2016  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and rich, this juicy wine is full of black fruits. It is balanced, with soft tannins partnering with berry flavors and acidity. The wine will develop well, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Briot 2016  Bordeaux

description: This rich, ripe and generous wine is full of blackberry fruit and tannin. It's powerful, with a solid structure and fine fruitiness. As a result, it has good aging potential, so drink from 2020.
title: Château les Conseillans 2015 Réserve du Pré carré  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, spicy wine shows indications of wood aging. At the same time it offers plenty of fruit, bright acidity and forward black-currant flavors. Made from two-thirds Merlot and one-third Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has good potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Gaudin 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine develops slowly in the glass, closed at first and then bringing on ripe fruits and firm tannins. There is a definite dryness here, solid, textured and darkly structured. It is meant for aging, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: There's a great structure here, and the wine is rich with prominent, firm tannins. It has the long-term potential to be an impressively structured wine, with the fruit balancing it out.
title: Haut Peyrefaure 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and already smooth, this full wine is juicy and jammy. Generous red fruits go well with the firmer tannic core that will allow it to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Belle-Garde 2016 Elevé en Fût  (Bordeaux)

description: While the wood aging is prominent, it doesn't take away from the complex, ripe fruits and acidity. In a word, this is balanced. It has good potential, as the toasty wood integrates over the next two years. Drink from 2015. Screwcap.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Another of the properties of Jean-Louis Despagne. This wine is rich and intense with flavors of mint and eucalyptus which give it an exotic element. It is powerful and concentrated, with soft tannins. It will be ready to drink in two or three years.
title: Château Bel Air Perponcher 1999 Grande Cuvee  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This complex, ripe wine balances firm wood aging with dark fruit. It's full in the mouth, juicy and with plenty of potential. Solid tannins and rich berry flavors are coming together. Wait until 2017.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2012 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine has been heavily extracted, giving an initial bitter coffee and a dry tannic character. The fruit weight will compensate for this, bringing out acidity, black plums and rich berries. It has the right concentration to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a finely balanced, already delicious wine. The tannins promise some aging potential, bringing a dry core to the rich blackberry fruit. It's firm, yet layered with fine juiciness. A forward wine that will still develop well.
title: Château Peugeais 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: From a blend dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine. Its tannins and black-currant fruit are balancing well, giving both a dry side and a rich, juicy aftertaste. This wine has good potential, so drink from 2022.
title: Château Leboscq 2015  Médoc

description: Michel Rolland is the consultant for this wine, and it shows in the hallmark dark purple color, the extracted ripe fruit and concentrated dry tannins. But it is certainly a well-crafted wine, that enough structure to make it ageworthy.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 1999  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Balance is at the heart of Eric and Sophie Meynaud's winemaking. Ripe and fruity, this is a perfumed wine that has a fine balance between the structure and the fruit. With its acidity and spice, it is going to develop into a delicious, juicy wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Clos Moulin Pontet 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This complex, spicy and fruity wine is big, with attractive acidity. It is piled with berry fruits that give a rich character. The fruits are supported by well-judged wood. This full-bodied wine will develop well; drink from 2017.
title: Château la Verriére 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is packed with just the right amount of tannins and dark fruits. It has weight, structure and a blackberry note. It needs to age at least five years for the full character to emerge.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A solid, fruity wine supported by ripe tannins. The wine has a good sense of its rich self, a fine presence of ripe plum fruit flavors and a warm texture. There is a fine juicy aftertaste.
title: Château du Juge 2010 Cru Camille  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dense wine, packed with great tannins and equally impressive black fruit. With its structure and concentration, the wine has an excellent future. It comes from a vineyard that looks out over the Garonne river with a good exposure, giving the wine's ripe fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Sainte-Catherine 2015 Jean Merlaut  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine from fifth-generation vigneron Jean-Michel Baudet is full of perfumed new wood and also plenty of ripe, black fruits, suggesting excellent potential. With structure and rich fruits, it is going to develop into a complex wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Ricaud 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe and smooth wine, full of dark fruits and tannins that are embedded in the richness. There is a balancing juicy character in this fruity wine. Dominated by ripe Merlot, the wine will develop quickly and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Clairac 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Produced by the team that makes Château Haut-Selves in the Graves, this wine is elegant, with a light touch of tannins and acidity. The wine offers spice from barrel aging as well as poised black fruit and acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Loumelat 2015 Cuvée J.J. Lesgourgues  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: There's a great balance of tannin and fruit in this wine. It has concentration and a bold structure that contrast with the black currant fruit and final acidity. It will develop slowly and well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Dubraud 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big on tannins and equally big on ripe fruit, this is a rich wine. Its dense texture and bold blackberry flavors are coming together well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Les Petits Arnaud 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich, fruity and full bodied, this spicy wine has a good future. Its tannins and structure are still firm and upfront, but the black fruits are ripe and generous. Drink this attractive wine from 2021.
title: Château Malbec 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe, rounded wine that displays fine tannins and a black fruit flavor that come together easily on the palate. It will age well and should be enjoyed from 2021.
title: Château Lamothe Castéra 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Celebrating the foundation of Cheval Quancard in 1844, this is a solid, dense and well-made wine from ripe grapes. The balance is good with tannins already integrating well into the juicy, ripe acidity. It's ready to drink but will age at least until 2019.
title: Cheval Quancard 2010 1844 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A dry, firm wine, full of its tannins. The juiciness underneath promises black currant brightness in six months to a year. With ample acidity and a fine sense of structure, this wine is concentrated and rich.
title: Château Peynaud-Bagnac 2011  Bordeaux

description: This firm, strongly tannic wine possesses all the right weight and richness. Dense tannins push the wine forward, with a sweet-tasting plum note, plus acidity. For aging over 4-5 years.
title: Château du Lort 2009  Bordeaux

description: This is a finely balanced, if still very structured wine. It has powerful tannins, but also rich, black, juicy fruits that are coming into integration. Solid and concentrated, the wine has great potential and needs to age for at least four years.
title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2010 Château Rauzan-Despagne Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: While rich in red fruit flavor and showing plenty of tannins, this is a balanced wine. It has enough structure and fruit to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2016 Cuvée Sarah  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is balanced: it is firm with tannins and rich with berry fruits. It has a fine structure that will stand it in good stead as it matures. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Parenchére 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Packed with fruit, this is going to be a generous wine. Certainly its tannins are very present, but the weight of the ripe berry fruits will come to dominate. There is a juicy crisp aftertaste. Drink this Maison Bouey wine from 2019.
title: Château Pas de Rauzan 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine from the Gonfrier family property is full of berry fruits. It's also a ripe wine that is already drinkable. It has generous tannins and balanced acidity that gives the wine its crisp edge as a contrast to the blackberry flavors. Drink now, or even better, wait until 2018.
title: Château le Gardera 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a firm wine-one with generous tannins and fruit. It has spice and touches of pepper as well as fine acidity and bold red fruits. The combination has produced a wine that will be ripe and ready to drink from 2019. The property has a history dating back to the 14th century.
title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a full, ripe wine. It has red fruits, black currants and a rich seam of tannins. There is also a smoky character that adds attraction. With a ripe aftertaste, the wine is developing well and should be ready from 2018.
title: Château de Cornemps 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A smooth, ripe wine that has rich fruit and balanced wood and fruit tannins. With mint flavors and a generous blackberry flavor, the wine is firm, with fine aging potential. It is a full-bodied wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With a dominance (90%) of Merlot, this wood-aged bottling is the second wine from Feret-Lambert. Rich and juicy, it offers soft tannins and full-bodied black fruits. A firmer structure underneath this ripe character will allow it to age. Round and generous, it will be best from 2017.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2012 Costes du Château Feret Lambert  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and toasty, this is a rich, full-bodied and juicy wine. It has ripe berry fruits, touches of black currant and balancing acidity. Wood aging supports the palate and adds considerable potential. Drink this fine wine from 2016.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Mint flavors reflect the new wood aging in this smooth, ripe wine. It has a fine structure, ample acidity and blackberry fruit. This textured, structured wine is ready for 4-6 years of aging.
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Round and fruity, this is dominated by generous fruit flavors and soft tannins. Its open character is backed up by notes of new wood, vanilla and some smoky spice. It's delicious now, and it will age over several years.
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is dense, with spice from wood aging and rich fruit. Black plum and berry flavors partner with a tannic structure in this concentrated wine. The organically grown grapes add their own purity. Drink this age-worthy wine from 2019.
title: Château du Ballandreau 2014 Cuvée Excellence  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This fruity wine from the Michel Boyer family is full of red-berry flavors and with attractive spice and tannins. Its wood is softening into the fruit letting a rich, concentrated wine develop. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Clos Bourbon 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fruity effort from the hill vineyards behind Castillon has weight, structure and a style characterized by full and ripe red fruit. The tannins are cushioned by the generous fruit, and the wine will improve over the next four years.
title: Château l'Estang 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Structured and still firm, this is a wine with some good potential. It's full of blackberry fruit and ripe tannins. Juicy acidity gives it a crisp edge, lifting the solid texture. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Roquevieille 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Led by Vincent Lacoste (the sixth generation), this is a rich wine, with smooth tannins and plenty of spice. The wood-aging flavors are already integrated into the generous black fruits and concentrated structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Cranne 2014 Sixiéme Géneration  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Warm and rich, the wine from vineyards on the slopes above Cadillac have the structure of the vintage along with the ripe, blackberry fruits. It is already attractive to drink, and will continue to age nicely over the medium term.
title: Château Suau 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This smooth, rich wine is well balanced, with a solid core of tannins supporting ripe blackberry fruits. The wine is still young, the tannins firm. But the balance is there and the wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2015  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: To the west of Saint-Estéphe, the swathe of vineyards extends into the forest. This estate has produced a firm, structured wine that, for the vintage, has good potential. It is already balanced between dry tannins and black-currant fruits, with spice and acidity thrown in. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Bourdieu Vertheuil 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc from just north of Saint-Émilion is still structured and firm. Big tannins and smoky flavors give a dense character. The black fruits still need time to round out and show smoothness. For now decant, or wait until 2017 to drink.
title: Château de Tabuteau 2012  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: While the wine is dominated by flavors of wood aging, it also has fine fruit weight that will come through. Then it will be a powerful and concentrated wine, rich and full of blackberry and black plum fruits. The structure will keep this fruitiness in order. Drink from 2017.
title: Château La Branne 2011  Médoc

description: This wine is full of ripe tannins along with dense, juicy black fruits. It is balanced, with tannins and spice on the one hand and great fruit and acidity on the other, promising good aging potential. This is a wine to keep and drink from 2022.
title: Château la Bastidette 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This serious, solid wine has plenty of smoky flavors, juicy black fruit and a firm background of tannins. Ripe, full of fruit and with fine acidity at the end, it will be ready from 2019.
title: Château la Bastidette 2012  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Firm tannins and concentrated black fruit flavors set this wine up for long-term aging. It has a solid core that gives it dryness at this young stage. But the bold blackberry fruit and acidity will come through to produce a generous, balanced wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Vieux Château des Combes 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: A special Cuvée of Château Siaurac, this is dark, dense, seriously young at this stage, but destined for a powerful, rich, black fruit and tannin future. It has weight and concentration, layered with new wood and acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Siaurac 2011 Baronne de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Perfumed new wood aromas lead into a wine that has its fair share of wood influence. Rich black fruit is also found, which is balanced with the toastiness. It's ripe and likely to offer even more pleasure in the next 2-3 years.
title: Château La Rame 2010  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and smoky, this is a warm fruity wine. It has tannins as well as juicy acidity, black fruits and a firm structure in the background. This will be a rich wine when it is ready to drink in 2018.
title: Château de Bel 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe, full and smooth, this obviously wood-aged wine has also managed to retain its ripe fruit. It's soft, full of acidity and black currants, with a good touch of spice to bring out the complexity of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Mirefleurs 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Structured and very rich, this has sweet tannins that provide weight while retaining the wine's ripe, fruity character. It has a solid, firm texture, and the wood influence gives a burst of firm toast. Age for 4-5 years.
title: Château Lauduc 2009 Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This 160-acre estate is located to the west of Saint-Émilion. The wine, with its firm tannins and plenty of wood-aging flavors, is rich and, in this vintage, dense. It has power from the black fruits and freshness from juicy acidity. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Rich and spicy, this 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from 10 acres generous and ripe, with warm tannins and a fruity, red berry character. This blend has attractive acidity and spicy flavors from the combination of wood and stainless-steel aging. This is only the second vintage from enologist Jean-Rémi Larrat's own property. It is worth aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Chatard 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This generously structured wine is rich in tannins and fine, ripe black fruit. Its structure and juicy acidity will allow it to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Ricaud 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big and bold, this is going to be an impressive Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend from a 2.5-acre plot on the Queyrens family estate. It has great red fruits and generous acidity, both of which are given a strong sense of structure by the tannins. At the moment, it is about potential, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Pilet 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: With the same winemaking team as Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande in Pauillac, Bernadotte has a good pedigree. The wine is full in the mouth, structured and balanced, with ripe berry fruits bursting out from the tannic shell. The wine will develop well over the next few years; drink from 2017.
title: Château Bernadotte 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: A dense wine, with strong elements of its wood aging still prominent, and smoothing out the tannins. It has power, a dark texture and superripe almost jammy fruits. The final has mint, spice and sweet plum juice.
title: Château Landat 2005  Haut-Médoc

description: This smooth and ripe wine is full of dark berry fruit and layered with tannins that will allow it to age. Although rich with black plum flavors, it's balanced with acidity. Fine and ageworthy, it will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château la Fleur 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is ripe and full of fruit. Tannins come through strongly giving the wine good structure and good potential. Concentrated, the wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine comes from a small parcel of Malbec, a grape once common in Bordeaux but now rare. The powerful tannins show that Malbec can now ripen easily in selected terroirs, thanks to climate change. The wine is full, spiced with wood and firm with a solid structure. It will age further, so drink this rich wine from 2021.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2016 La Viminiére Malbec  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a densely textured wine, packed with dark tannins as well as black fruits. It is concentrated, boasting the structure of the vintage. Blackberries vie with the firm structure, with both suggesting plenty of potential. Drink this Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2016 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A wine that's straight down the line, firmly structured and with solid fruit for the future. There is weight and richness, a sense of power waiting to show in the future. With its density, anticipate aging this wine for at least 6-7 years.
title: Château Grand Moulin 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From an estate that dates to the 16th century, this wine is a ripe, structured example of this great vintage. It has layers of tannins as well as exemplary black-currant fruits. The acidity and structure are right there, giving a wine with excellent potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Peyredoulle 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Concentrated and smoky, this wine has plenty of black cherry and black currant fruit. Its firm tannins promise that aging that will make it a richly endowed wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2015 Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is juicy and fruity, with generous tannins that support its ripe black fruit and balanced acidity. It has a smoky edge and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Le Cap 2015 Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe fruit, juicy acidity and a fine balance of tannins give this wine great potential. It's full of blackberry flavors as well as some solid, structured tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Magdeleine Bouhou 2015 Boha  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a complex wine that offers firm tannins and rich fruit. It has weight, density and a strong sense of ripeness. With balance and depth, it's a wine with good aging potential. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Loumelat 2011 Cuvée J-J Lesgourgues  (Bordeaux)

description: Wood-aged and smoky, this is a solid, firm wine. It is balanced, and its ripe fruits are already present, offering a rich experience of warm tannins and black plum fruitiness. It will broaden and soften over the next 3-4 years.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2010 Château Tour de Mirambeau Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a dense and rich wine full of black plum fruits, rich tannins and a dark structure. It has great potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Queyssard 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Powerful and structured, this offers both the weight and the potential for rich fruit. Dominated at this stage by tannins and wood-influenced flavors, the black plum note is likely to come through in the next year. The acidity is crisp, and a bitter cherry character flavors the finish.
title: Château Trocard Monrepos 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Here's a concentrated effort, with its tannins providing a powerful force behind the sweet-tasting fruit. A flavor of wood shows strongly, and the wine has a rich, full-bodied feel, with fine structure for aging.
title: Château Les Graviéres de la Brandille 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
winery: Château Les Graviéres de la Brandille

description: The wine has fine, juicy fruit over smooth tannins. Its smoky flavors, touches of wood aging and rich tannic structure are integrating well. It will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Baracan 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The second wine of Château de Belcier, this is a rich, juicy wine with great black fruits. It is already attractive, although the tannins promise aging potential. Its ripe structure and final acidity suggest it should age over the medium term, ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château de Belcier 2016 B de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Very young, this wine is just setting out. It has firm tannins, dark-chocolate flavors that give some bitterness and layers of wood and dark-black fruits from organic grapes. It is going to take time for this ripe concentrated wine to develop. The acidity and black-plum-skin texture at the end show it will age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Fongaban 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A selection from the best grapes and parcels, this is a dense, firm wine with both great tannins and dark fruits. Acidity gives a lift to the dry core of the wine and brings out the black currant fruits. Wood aging is still showing, so the wine needs time. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Pitray 2012 Premier Vin  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big tannins and ripe fruits result in a wine that is dense and structured. The wood aging is apparent, thanks to a smoky character that pushes over the black currant fruit. From vineyards on slopes above the Garonne river, this is a solid wine with a good future. Drink from 2017.
title: Château La Grange Clinet 2012 Grande Réserve  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This rich, balanced wine is ripe and juicy. With layers of black fruits and well-integrated tannins, it has a dense texture while also packing a punch of great fruitiness. The fruit and tannins are ripe. This wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château la Graviére 2015 Cuvée les Terrasses  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: With ripe Merlot dominating this fine, blackberry flavored wine, it is fruity and rich. The acidity gives a crisper edge to the wine while the tannins come from a dry core. It is a wine in progress, full of potential and likely to be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2014  Fronsac

description: The wine comes from a selection of parcels on the Castera estate. With a majority (60%) of Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine is structured and firm and still developing. It has red-berry and black-currant fruit along with plenty of tannic structure. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Château Castera 2015 Château Bourbon la Chapelle  (Médoc)

description: Merlot gives this wine its richness and density. Partial oak aging adds to the ripe, smooth texture. Tannins, layers of spice and bold red fruits add concentration as well as juicy acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2015  Fronsac

description: This dark, structured wine with firm tannins has the potential for richness. That comes from the blackberry flavors that are coming through the dry structure. The fruit hints at juiciness as well as acidity. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2022.
title: Château Magdeleine Bouhou 2016 Boha  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Blaye sister-brother team of Marie-Pierre et Pierre-Charles Dartier are hitting the mark with this certified sustainable wine. With touches of wood aging giving the wine a minty character, this is stylish and ripe. It is still young, while showing plenty of signs of good potential, black-currant fruits and richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Clos Mansio 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Smooth and spicy, this is an attractive, rounded and ripe wine. It has weight and richness from wood and black plum and currant fruits. The acidity is a fine counterpoint. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roquefort 2011  Bordeaux

description: In this ripe, spicy wine, solid tannins back up berry flavors. This wine is intended for aging, with its tannins and fruit density. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Mirambeau Papin 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine. With fine tannins and rich black-currant fruits, it is concentrated and complex. Ripeness shines through the tannins to give a wine with aging ability. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Lauduc 2016 Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Spicy, ripe and fruity, this wine has enough structure to give shape to the broad black fruits that are the stars. A smoky element comes from just the right amount of wood aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Recougne 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is fruity and toasty from new-wood aging. Its black fruits are dense with tannins, rich with spice and a round texture. It's likely to become a ripe wine; drink from 2020.
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2015 Léo by Léo  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich blackberry and black-currant flavors give this wine its ripe character. They are already well balanced by the spicy tannins and dry core. The wine will develop well and should be ready from 2019. This is the last vintage under the Fournier-Casteja family. In December, Birot was sold to Miaolin Chen's New Century Tourism Group based in Hangzhou, China.
title: Château de Birot 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While this wine has obviously seen plenty of wood aging, it's also full of dark blackberry fruit. Together, those qualities give density and structure, with acidity and fruitiness to match. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Marsan 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Anne-Marie and Jean-Guy Todeschini started a revolution here and at Château Mangot and sons Karl and Yann (mid-Millennials) are moving it on. They use Jean-Pierre Cousinié's terroir analysis (look it up), no pesticides, experiment with no sulfur and are changing the way their terroir talks to the wine. This vintage is a rich wine with attractive black currant fruit and fine acidity. With structured tannins and light spice, it is fruity, juicy and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château la Brande 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This juicy Merlot/Cabernet Franc blend is balanced and fresh with great red fruits and soft tannins. Acidity gives a crisp flavor while the fragrant smokiness allows for future development. This comes from a nine-acre, high-density, hand-picked parcel on a limestone plateau among the Querre family vineyards. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Aiguilhe Querre 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich, structured and juicy, this wine shows black fruit tones, with its firm tannins and fine acidity. It's developing into a warm, ripe wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château La Grange Clinet 2015  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The d'Arfeuille family, also owners of vineyards in Saint-Émilion, have produced a richly juicy wine from this 20-acre estate. It's a rich wine with fine tannins, a smoky character, strongly structured and with excellent potential. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Tessendey 2015  Fronsac

description: This well-balanced blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot offers black-currant flavors. Its tannins and firm, dry core promise aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Château les Hauts de Gadet 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This rich wine is approaching maturity. Secondary animal aromas, dried fruit and richness are showing well, allowing this ripe wine to shine. The warm 2009 vintage comes out in the density and the dusty tannins. This is ready to drink.
title: Château Malescasse 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: From vineyards close to Saint-Estéphe, this wine has something of the dark tannins and dry character when young. Ripe fruit under the chocolate, coffee and new-wood flavors shows the potential for aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Pontoise Cabarrus 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Smooth and ripe, this is a finely balanced wine. New wood shows in the mint flavor, which is surrounded by a black currant note, plus fresh acids and tannins that promise aging. From the north of the Haut-Médoc, this is a chateau to watch.
title: Château le Chêne 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: This round and ripe wine is already drinkable, full of juicy fruit and acidity. The structure is generous, with a core of tannins and dash of minerality from the gravel soils that are a reminder that the wine can age. Drink this delicious wine now, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2012  Médoc

description: An obviously wood-aged wine, it has smoky aromas and flavors that are covering the ripe blackberry fruits. Along with the firm tannins and structure, it makes for a rich, full wine that needs aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2011  Médoc

description: A rich and smooth wine, this is packed with black fruits that are touched with smoky tannins from the wood aging. It's full, fruity and structured on the palate. It will age over at least 5-6 years, but, with its rich texture, it will be drinkable soon.
title: Château Tour Saint-Vincent 2010  Médoc

description: This is a firm yet ripe wine that boasts ripe black-plum flavors layered with dense and dusty tannins. The wine is concentrated, with wood aging filling out the structure. It is big and bold, finishing with great ripe fruit.
title: Château Lanbersac 2009  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Attractive mints and wood tannins are balanced by generous blackberry fruit and a chocolate flavor that lends extra richness. It has great aging potential; keep this concentrated wine for 5-6 years.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2010 Elegance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is the result of a joint venture between negociant Ginestet and the Larrivet Haut-Brion chateau. The result is a wine that has all the softness and rich berries of the vintage as well as generous tannins and spice. This wine has style and good fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2015 Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Bordeaux)

description: This ripe wine is full of black fruits and ripe tannins, suggesting a fine future. It's structured and dense, which promises richness as it develops and opens up. Give this concentrated wine until 2022.
title: Château Recougne 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Poised between tannins and dark fruit, with 20 months in oak, this ripe wine has touches of dark chocolate as well as layers of spice and wood aging. All that will change as the rich wine develops. Concentrated and dense, it needs aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Bel-Air 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a big, ripe, fruity wine, with some serious tannins that support the smooth mint and black currant flavors. It has weight, with the wood aging shining through. There is attractive acidity on the close.
title: Château Goubau 2010 La Source  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A smooth, beautifully rich wine with great swathes of ripe fruit. The wine is concentrated and dense, showing the best of the year with its fine, ripe fruits. Age for 3-4 years.
title: Château Nardou 2010  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Unusually for the Médoc, this wine has a significant percentage (14.5%) of Cabernet Franc as well as 12.5% Petit Verdot. These two grapes give the wine its perfume and its dark color. They add to the rich tannins and juicy black currants that pack the wine. Drink this fine wine from 2020.
title: Château Charmail 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: From the northern end of the Haut-Médoc region, close to Saint-Estéphe, this dark-hued wine is still very structured. Smoky wood-aging flavors give complexity that balances the ripe black currant fruitiness. It's still developing, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Château Larrivaux 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A concentrated wine, juicy and rich in fruit, with ripe blackberries and attractive acidity. There is some weight along with the fruitiness and tannins in harmony with the fruit. Worth aging for 3-5 years.
title: Château Semonlon 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Perfumed new-wood aromas give this wine a toasty start. On the palate, the fruit is evident, showing luscious red-plum and black currant flavors. There are attractive notes of toast and pepper as the wine smoothes out on the palate.
title: Château Pontoise Cabarrus 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: A fine wine, layered with tannins and dark plum skin flavors over a firm core of dryness, with excellent balancing acidity that finishes the wine on a fresh note.
title: Château Liversan 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: This estate, belonging to the Compagnet family, is in the northern Médoc. Some firm tannins are contrasted with the attractive acidity and berry fruits to create a warm spicy wine. Almost equal amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot give a balanced wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Pey 2015  Médoc

description: This is a ripe concentrated wine with attractive smoky tannins as well as fresh acidity. It is perfumed with black-currant fruits that are laced with the dry structure as well as acidity. With a year or two more in bottle, this will be a finely balanced wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Bégadanet 2013  Médoc

description: The small area of Pez is one of the top sites in Saint-Estéphe, with many highly rated chateaus. This is one. New wood aging shows strongly at this stage, although so does the fruit. That gives a structured wine, firm and also full of blackberry fruit flavors. The future is good for this wine, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2012  Saint-Estéphe

description: Under the watchful eye of consultant Eric Delacroix, the Bazin twins (Thierry and Odile) created a wine that is dark and dense. This is a young wine with good potential. Its black fruits and solid tannins are rich and structured. Acidity and ripeness go together and will let the wine develop well. Drink from 2019.
title: Château la Roche Bazin 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While this young wine is dry now, it has good potential with rich fruits developing well. Dark and firm at the moment, it will become a generous rounded wine as it ages. The 30-acre Etienne Barre and Christophe Reboul Salze estate is managed by the Stephane Derenoncourt team. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Belle Coline 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe, smoky and still-tannic wine, this is solidly structured. A dense, dry core shows some sign of extraction although the blackberry fruits are developing well. As the wine ages, it will bring out the balance between acidity and structure. Drink from 2017. Owner Cyril Trias works with Alliance Bourg co-operative on his wines.
title: Château Chantemerle 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a generous wine from Jean-Pierre Soubie. It has fine tannins that are already well integrated into the perfumed red-berry fruits. This is going to be a delicious, while always crisp, wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Lisennes 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a perfumed wine, full of rich fruit and spice. The acidity is present to give the wine a lift. It will develop well, becoming smooth and rich over the next two years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Mirambeau Papin 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is ripe and smooth with a fine balance between acidity and the red fruits. It is light on tannins, concentrating on the fruitiness. The aftertaste with its spice is dense and ripe. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2014 Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Produced by the winemaking team from Château la Gaffeliére in Saint-Emilion, this is a fine, smooth and ripe wine. It has black fruits and a structure that is well integrated into the rich wood and acidity. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Château la Gaffeliére 2014 Château Chapelle d'Aliénor  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine shows extraction, new wood and firm tannins. What it also has is the fruit weight to sustain all this. Given 4-5 years, the wine's richness and smoky flavors will come together with the black currant fruit.
title: Château Darzac 2011 Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a structured wine, with solid tannins and ample woody flavors. But it has the fruit weight to sustain the structure, offering a wine that promises good aging as well as short-term attractive fruitiness.
title: Château Barreyre 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a powerful, complex, wood-aged wine. The elements are all present, but the fruit dominates at the moment. It's rich and concentrated, showing the potential of a balanced, ripe wine. With all this density and structure, give it four years.
title: Château Darzac 2010 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a perfumed wine, and its new wood and violet aromas create equally pleasant flavors. The surface-level brilliance is followed by rich, dark tannins and a blackberry note.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2010 Cuvee le Barry  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This oak-aged wine is the top Cuvée from this estate. The wood is prominent at this young stage, although there is also plenty of black fruit. The wood, as it integrates, will enrich this ripe wine, bringing out the firm structure. The wine needs to age. Drink from 2020.
designation: La Grande Dame de Château Lavagnac
title: Château de Lavagnac 2015 La Grande Dame de Château Lavagnac  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Jean-Christophe Darriet has produced a rich wine with black fruits from this tiny vineyard within the ramparts of Cadillac's 15th-century castle. Juicy acidity and blackberry flavors balance with the solid structure and firm tannins. Drink from 2021.
title: Vignobles Darriet 2016 Clos du Château de Cadillac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A solidly based wine that offers both rich black fruits and fragrant acidity. It has weight and great concentration, with a long-term future. Keep for 4-5 years for the best effect.
title: Château Saint-Nicolas 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A classically structured, stalky Bordeaux, with added superripe fruit. The result is a wine with firm, young tannins that merge with the juicy sweet black currant and intense fruitiness to finish. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Léon 2010 Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big tannins don't hide the fruitiness of this ripe Merlot-dominated wine. It has concentration, a dark core of powerful tannins that bring out black-coffee accents. At the same time, rich blackberry flavors are right up there. Drink the Dominique Bessineau wine from 2022.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Fermented and aged in oak, this wine has solid tannins and rich black fruits. The wine is still very young, dry to the core but also with plenty of fruit potential as well as dark-coffee flavors. Drink from 2021.
designation: Arion by Château Moulin de Clotte
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2015 Arion by Château Moulin de Clotte  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins along with ripe and juicy berry fruits mark out this rich wine. Aged partially in wood, this blend is dominated by Merlot. Juicy, full of solid tannins, the wine will age for several more years. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Bréhat 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: There is a fine balance between the firm tannins and the ripe fruit in this wine. It has juicy acidity, spice and layers of delicious black-currant flavors. The fourth generation, Nathalie Boyer and Alain Tourenne, converted vines to Ecocert-certified organic beginning in 2008. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Beynat 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Structured, concentrated wine, showing the firm texture of the vintage with firm tannins balancing intense acidity. The wine has power-witness the alcohol-but this is contained in a more elegant texture. Best to age this wine for 4-5 years.
title: Château de Monbadon 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A purple-colored, young wine dominated by Merlot, this is rich, structured and full of blackberries. With a good balance between the fruit and the tannins already in place, it shows excellent potential. Drink this already delicious but still firm wine from 2022.
title: Château Brûle Sécaille 2016 Grande Réserve  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Dense and solid, its black fruits are firmly embedded in the big, dry tannins. It's powerful, with layers of acidity that give freshness to this complex, ageworthy wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Pradier 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: A perfumed wine, dominated by Merlot. It shows plenty of the structure of 2010, a firm and solid wine, full of oak aging flavors at this young stage. It's going to be a rich and full wine layered with blackberry fruits as it develops over the next 4-5 years.
title: Château Fougas 2010 Maldoror  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Stéphane Asséo, who also owns L'Aventure in Paso Robles, California, runs this estate as one of the star properties in Castillon. The wine is rich and plummy, with dense, soft fruit, dusty tannins, layers of new wood and ripe black fruits. Drink now, or keep for 2-3 years.
title: Château Robin 2003  Cotes de Castillon

description: Spice and ripe fruit, with attractive tannins and a soft texture. This wine is open, generous, rich and packed with black currant fruitiness. Give this wine another 2-4 years, but it could well be drinkable sooner.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2011 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)

description: This wine offers fine fruit, attractive acidity and touches of spice and dryness from the wood aging. It all hangs together, giving a wine that has a promising future as the tannins soften and the fruit asserts itself. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Venus 2016  Graves

description: With an unusually high proportion (nearly 17%) of Petit Verdot in the blend, this is both darkly structured and dark in color. It is weight, intense youthful acidity and black-currant fruits. It's also rich, full of tannins and in need of several years. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Retout 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is one a group of chateaus just to the north of Saint-Estéphe owned by the Fabre family. Ripe and rich, it is already a smooth and fruity wine. Black plums and black currants shine here supported by a dry core of tannins that is sure to soften. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Landat 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Located between the city of Bordeaux and Margaux, this estate regularly produces good quality. In 2013, the producers have managed to highlight good fruit and dry tannins that also sustain the juiciness. The wine is still firm and will take a while to develop, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Paloumey 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: In this complex wine, surface fruitiness doesn't mask the firm layers of tannins that give shape and density. It's full of black plum flavors that show a juicy side to what is also a wine for long-term aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Paloumey 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: There is a fine sense of structure in this dense and solid effort. It has both a juicy black-currant note and a full-bodied, concentrated texture. Showing the richness as well as the dry core of 2010, it is ready to age over several years.
title: Château Lieujean 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: A wine that shows rich blackberry fruits, already rounded and soft. It has a tannic structure that is embedded in the fruit, along with spice, toast and a firm finish. An ageworthy wine.
title: Château Liversan 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine is packed with dusty tannins. Mint flavors show the wood aging while black currant boosts the fruit side of the wine. It is rich, its fruit very ripe yet also elegant.
title: Château Lieujean 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: A smooth wine that softens well, but that still retains rich fruits and dense, dusty tannins. There is good power here, from blackberry and red plums, the texture of velour. Drink now and over the next 3-4 years.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2005  Haut-Médoc

description: Set in the heart of Haut-Médoc and close to the 18th-century fortress designed to stop the British attacking through the Gironde estuary (they never tried), this estate has made a firm, tannic wine that has great black fruits and a rich potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Considerable depth of flavor here, with complex ripe tannins, topping the dense black fruits. There's spice from the wood, some stalky tannins from the fruit, and an edge of youth that will need 3-4 years to show its potential.
title: Château Caronne Ste Gemme 2005  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine, now maturing well, has great berry fruits that are now softening into the generous texture. It is ripe while keeping a poised, crisp character. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château des Annereaux 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

description: From one of a group of chateaus owned by the Guyon family of Rolland de By, this is an intensely fruity wine. It has finely balanced tannins and acidity along with smoky flavors and layers of delicious black currant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château La Clare 2014  Médoc

description: Produced from 30-year-old vines, this 55% Cabernet Sauvignon wine is firm with tannins as well as black-currant fruit. It is balanced with the potential to become a fruity wine with a soft texture. The acidity will keep it crisp and on point. Drink from 2018.
title: Château La Branne 2014  Médoc

description: New wood aromas come through strongly in this firm, solid wine. The wood is a prominent element, giving spice and a burnt edge. Under this is ripe fruit character-black currants and berries that need another 3-5 years to show their best.
title: Château la Tour de By 2010  Médoc

description: The wood element is powerful here, giving a smooth, polished character to the otherwise tightly knit fruit. Flavors of bitter coffee, spice and barbecued meats are there, with the juicy acidity and a dense texture. The wine needs another year to come together.
title: Bernard Magrez 2005 Château la Tempérance  (Médoc)

description: The 30% new barrels really show in this toasty, spicy wine. This intense wood aging is saved by the rich underlying fruit that delivers great concentration and blackberry flavors. Given time these will balance with the wood, produce a ripe, fruity wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2015  Médoc

description: Firmly tannic, this wine shows dark-coffee flavors as well as solid black fruits. It has the richness of the vintage, although that is muted for the moment by the solid structure. Wait for this powerful wine to develop and drink from 2021.
title: Château Teyssier 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: A ripe, juicy and smoky wine that is already attractive to drink. It has soft tannins, ripe red berries with acidity and black currants at the end. Drink this fine wine from 2020.
title: Château Maucaillou 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Dark-chocolate flavors are happily balanced by ripe black fruits that give this wine weight. It has a good long-term future, with plenty of wood aging playing with the rich fruitiness. The wine is produced by Bordeaux-born Jean Lissague. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Grand Secret 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: For the region, this Taïx family property is large at 79 acres. Wood aging has given this wine a smoky, spicy character that contrasts with the juicy black-cherry and blueberry flavors. Its structure is still firm, showing the tannins of the vintage. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Fongaban 2016  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: While there are strong wood flavors here, the wine also has a good rich weight from the blackberry fruits. It is a concentrated wine with spice and some dry tannins that will integrate well. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Château de Parenchére 2014 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Merlot is initially firm with dry tannins and a powerful structure. This will soften as the bright black-currant flavor from the Cabernet begins to shine. The wine, produced in the southern part of Haut-Médoc, will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Paloumey 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Fonréaud's vineyard is on the highest point of the Médoc (all of 120 feet). This vintage shows a smooth, ripe wine full of juicy black fruits. It's not dense, and the fruitiness will let it age relatively quickly. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Fonréaud 2013  Listrac-Médoc

description: Under the same control as Château Ferriére, this wine reveals the same sense of power, style and elegance. It is polished, packed with ripe fruit and dense tannins. Tobacco and cedar aromas make this an immediately enticing wine that still offers great potential for aging.
title: Château la Gurgue 2001  Margaux

description: The Mau family, who also run négociants Yvon Mau, have poured money into this Médoc chateau, bringing it back to life. It has paid off in this powerful, rich 2003, which packs blackberry flavors alongside new wood, polished tannins and  impressive aging potential. Imported by Victoire Imports.
title: Château Preuillac 2003  Médoc

description: Classic, balanced wine with a twist of richness. The black currant flavors are almost jelly-like in their sweetness, although these flavors are well balanced with acidity and a firm layer of dry tannins.
title: Château Preuillac 2005  Médoc

description: From one of the fine estates on the Pez plateau at the heart of Saint-Estéphe, this firm and structured wine seems at this stage to have absorbed too much wood flavor, which gives toughness. However, plenty of fruit is currently being masked, so the wine should develop well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2013  Saint-Estéphe

description: Wood aromas from aging for 12 months in barrels dominate this wine and the wood shows strongly on the palate. However, the berry flavors and acidity are also well placed to integrate with the wood and tannic structure. so the wine should age well. Drink this Vignobles Bayle Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Château Barbé 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The Dartier sister-and-brother team created a wine of rich fruit and minty aromas balanced by new wood and black fruit flavors. Harvested late in the season, as was typical for the vintage, it's a ripe wine that's fruity and juicy, yet structured and firm. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2016 Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured and fruity, this 25-acre vineyard of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc has produced a blend that is solid and with a good future. It has black fruits and firm tannins along with well-judged wood aging (six to eight months). It is ripe, with attractive juicy flavors and spice. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Gauthier 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a wood-aged wine with spice and vanilla flavors, fine berry fruits and a rich texture. It is firm, while also rich and generous. The weight, the ripeness and the structure all promise aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Pierrail 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Solid and structured, delicious and fruity, this has all the elements of a firm, balanced wine, with a black fruit flavor and sweet acidity, plus a fragrant, smoky finish. Age for 4-5 years.
title: Château Barreyre 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wood-aged wine, with 60% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, is dark colored and equally full of dark fruit. Blackberries and firm tannins mark out the wine for aging. The aftertaste with acidity and generous fruitiness show the wine's potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Lagarde 2016 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is an opulent, ripe wine that is full of black fruits and firm tannins. It is dense and concentrated with layers of juicy fruit piled over a drier core. It's a full-bodied wine that's still going to develop. Drink now or wait until 2017.
title: Château de Belcier 2009  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While structured and firm, this is a ripe and juicy wine. Its texture has some minerality, lending an edge to intensely youthful acidity. As the wine ages, all these elements will integrate well, so drink from 2016.
title: Château La Clariére Laithwaite 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe, smoky and with attractive fruits sustained by dark tannins, this wine comes from parcels that slope towards the river. Its concentration, rich black fruits and hints of dark chocolate and licorice all show potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château le Doyenne 2016  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is named for Arnaud Puyanché, who moved to Francs to make wine but put the project on hold due to the Great War of 1914. Five generations later, the family has revived his dream of producing estate wines. Ripe and full of red fruits, this 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc is concentrated and rich. The tannins are fine and already integrated into the fruits. With the acidity at the end, this is a well-balanced wine with a good future. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Puyanché 2014  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold, ripe and full of generous flavors, this Guignard brothers' wine is already showing its great potential. Rich black fruits are full of promise, with supporting acidity and a backdrop of tannins. Drink this full wine from 2022.
title: Château d'Uza 2016  Graves

description: This young, fruity wine from Vignobles Lesgourgues has great potential. Along with its bright red and blackberry fruits, it has succulent acidity and touches of wood aging that have smoothed the fruity character. It needs to age longer, so keep until 2018.
title: Château Haut Selve 2014  Graves

description: This is a ripe, attractive wine that is ready to drink. The red fruits are now mature giving a rich, smooth character. The tannins, still firm, act as a support for all this generous fruit. Drink now and until 2025.
title: Château Tourteran 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: Full of spice from wood aging and generous fruit, the wine is balanced and poised. It has a style to it, the Merlot perfumed with a touch of Cabernet Franc and made rich with its structure and density. The wine will age, and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château des Arnauds 2015 Cuvée des Capucins  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Smooth and rich, this has fine black and red cherry flavors, along with structured, dry tannins. There is a spice note from the wood aging, which is balanced by the acidity. The finish has a fine, generous texture. Give this wine at least four years.
title: Château Tour Haut-Caussan 2010  Médoc

description: Smooth and unctuous in texture, this has dense black fruits that edge toward dryness from the tannins. Dark chocolate and licorice notes lend a bitter edge. Rich and modern in style, this should age over the next 5-6 years.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château les Grands Chênes  (Médoc)

description: The team at neighboring Château Chasse-Spleen makes the wine here, giving the wine a sheen as well as enhancing its firm structure. Big tannins parallel black fruits in a promising mélange of flavors. It will age; drink from 2018.
title: Château Gressier Grand Poujeaux 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Made to be drunk young, this ripe, black-fruit wine has generous tannins that are well integrated into the fruit and acidity. Smoky, spicy and with a generous structure, it will be ready from 2019.
designation: Le Différent de Château de Ferrand
title: Château de Ferrand 2015 Le Différent de Château de Ferrand  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a rich, smoke and tannin-filled wine. Still young, the black-plum fruits are in the background, suggesting ripe juiciness for the future. Produced from vines on the east end of the plateau of Saint-Émilion, it is full bodied and will develop well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bardoulet 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Without added sulfur, this ripe, berry-flavored wine has intense fruitiness and acidity. It comes from two parcels of Merlot producing ripe, jammy fruit as well as good acidity. The tannins are fully integrated, giving a wine that is solid, dense and juicy. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Mercier 2016 Atmosphére Merlot  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: With 90% Merlot, this Denis Lafon wine is ripe and jammy. It has a good structure, showing the wood aging strongly. Touches of licorice contrast with the big black-fruit flavors and dense texture. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2015 La Révélation  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is full of potential with its rich fruits and generous tannins. Spice from wood aging partners with juicy blackberry flavors and a generous texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Floreal Laguens 2016 Messidor  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a firmly structured and concentrated wine, featuring black fruit that has the weight to balance the dense, solid tannins. Powered by the richness of the vintage, this should age for 3-4 years.
title: Château Plaisance 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: In this vintage from the sixth generation in the Lacoste family, this juicy wine also has firm tannins that promise good aging. From organic grapes, it offers weight, concentration and a dark structure that will soften over the next few years. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Cranne 2016 Château Jeandebout  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A perfumed, wood-aged wine, this is rich, full of fruit and structure, and obviously worth aging. Almost equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon have produced an aromatic wine packed with black currant fruit and dark tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Selve 2011  Graves

description: This is a 14 acre estate, producing a structured wine. With its firm tannins, the initial taste is of a dry core. Surrounding it are the ripe berry fruits that are going to give this wine its vitality. Firm at the end, this fine wine will age at least until 2021.
title: Château Guitignan 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This is the second vintage in this range from Bordeaux's top Left Bank appellation. The wine is structured, with the class to be expected of a Pauillac. The black-currant fruitiness of Cabernet Sauvignon dominates, giving elegance and a rich texture at the same time. The wine needs time, so drink from 2021.
title: Kirkland Signature 2015  Pauillac

description: Structured, firm and with the potential of ripe fruits, this wine from Sainte-Foy's first vintage as a Cotes de Bordeaux is ready for aging. Aged in amphorae, it has weight, concentration and dark tannins. The black fruits from biodynamic vines are still waiting to come through what will be a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Pré La Lande 2016 Terra Cotta  (Sainte-Foy Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Very structured wine that shows its wood aging as well as textured black plum fruits. It has spice, toast and a smoky character. Underneath are blackberry fruits and a strong layer of acidity. Age for 3-4 years.
title: Château Bertinerie 2008 Cru Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Elegant, rich and fruity, with just the right amount of tannic structure. The wine has black currant, sweet acidity and a dense and concentrated texture. While it is rich, it also has a good long, elegant aftertaste.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2009  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Solid and balanced, this has both great fruits and a great structure. Dense, rich and layered with tannins and black currant fruits, it has an opulent, ripe character. Drink this solid, attractive wine from 2017.
title: Château de Parenchére 2012 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Structured and still firm, this is a dense wine from the Donze family estate. It has firm tannins over the rich, juicy black fruits that are generous and reflect the vintage. This wine is still young, so wait and drink from 2020.
title: Château Martinat 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: The aromas and initial taste are all of new wood. Only later does some fresh red fruit appear, giving the wine a lift. There is enough fruit here, but this needs time for the wood to calm down. Then the wine will show the vibrancy the structure suggests.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2004  Graves

description: Ripe and juicy, this is an elegant wine. It has red-berry fruitiness shot through with acidity and spiced with the wood aging. It is still developing and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Corconnac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Heavily dominated by Merlot, this is a generous and full-bodied wine. Wood aging has left its mark in the burnt, toasty character. The fruit, though, is generous, bringing out the richness of the limestone soil. This wine will be ripe and full-bodied. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Reysson 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: While the wine is very dense, it also has layers of very ripe fruits, plums and dark berries that give it an intensely rich character. The juicy acidity is almost overwhelming, a shock of freshness as it cuts through the concentrated texture. The wine still needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut-Logat 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: This is rich, full of jammy Merlot and with layers of tannins interspersed with crisp acidity. It feels full, ripe, structured and likely to age well. With its youthful exuberance, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château les Graves de Lavaud 2013  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Complex and solid, it holds rich berry fruits, a darkly tannic structure, dense texture and a juicy acidity. This firm wine has a good future, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Château Griviére 2011  Médoc

description: It shows good weight, ripe fruit and well-judged wood aging. Berry fruit flavors are supported by dusty tannins and a dense texture. At the end, the juicy acidity gives a shot of freshness. Age this well-balanced wine and drink from 2017.
title: Château La Cardonne 2011  Médoc

description: This is the second wine of Clos Manou, a small vineyard located in the northern Médoc. It has a minty aroma, rich tannins and layers of spice from the 50% new wood aging. Drink this structured wine from 2023.
title: Clos Manou 2015 Petit Manou  (Médoc)

description: This full and structured wine offers good acidity, firm tannins and layers of black-currant flavors. It has good potential with richness, weight and balance. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Vigneau 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Always one of the leaders in the Premiéres Cotes, Château Carignan has produced a ripely juicy 2006. It is a wine that brings considerable weight, the dark fruits melding into tannins. It should age well over the next 5-6 years.
title: Château Carignan 2006  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The dusty tannins dominate this firm and dry wine. With its new wood aging and its concentration, it is complex and dense. The ripe black fruit offers power and sweetness. The wine is likely to age well over five years or more.
title: Château Lanbersac 2009 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: A big, solid wine, with dark flavors and dense tannins, very dry. The high extraction and wood tastes are still young, and at this stage the wine needs decanting. Ideally it needs time to smooth out.
title: Château Mondorion 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: This firm and structured Merlot-based wine conveys a light touch of wood from older barrels. It is rich with tannins and fruit. The dry core surrounded by ripe blackberry fruits promises a rich future. Drink this well-structured wine from 2022.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A eucalyptus oil aroma offers a smooth and fragrant introduction to this ripe, rich and juicy wine. Its polished feel works, offering both richness and solid tannins. It's for aging over at least five years.
title: Château Glorit 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a concentrated wine that is structured and packed with red fruits and solid tannins. It feels weighty and rich; the juicy character is balanced by a firm, dry texture. For aging over several years.
title: Château Haut Mazerolles 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Generous tannins and blackberry fruit, along with a smooth texture all contribute to the richness of this broad, ripe wine. The 79% Merlot in the blend lends a generous character and the likelihood it will age quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Chantemerle 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Mint aromas and the wood flavors of this wine give it a sweet character that contrasts with the juicy fruits and good acidity that come through strongly. This ripe, balanced wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2016 Damnation  (Bordeaux)

description: A structured wine, this is full of firm tannins and has juicy fruit underneath. It has attractive acidity, some smoky flavors and a firm aftertaste. All this means the wine needs to develop, and it will be better to drink from 2017.
title: Château Thieuley 2014 Réserve Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux)

description: With 15 months wood aging, this is a powerful wood-aged wine. Black currant fruits from the 39% Cabernet Sauvignon dominate. Soft tannins are doing a great job of supporting the natural fruitiness, bringing out a good sense of concentration. Warm and ripe, it will develop well. Drink from 2017
title: Château Feret Lambert 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Smooth wood and spice flavors give this wine immediate attractiveness. It has weight and richness, ripe fruit flavors and a spacious feel to the texture. With its complex structure, it's a wine for aging, so drink after 2016.
title: Château de Macard 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This large estate on the slopes above the river Garonne has produced a Merlot-dominated wine. It is rich while already finely balanced. It has juicy red fruits with a solid dry core that promises aging. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Carignan 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rich wine is still young, but packed with dark tannins and concentrated black-currant fruitiness. This hand-picked blend of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon needs to age. It will not be ready to drink before 2019. The chateau is the home of the Dubourdieu family.
title: Château Reynon 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While the wine is firm and tannic now, its fruit potential is excellent. Blackberry flavors are already evident, pushing through the dry structure to give a ripe, full-bodied wine. The Verdier family's Merlot-dominant vineyards are organic and biodynamic. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Brethous 2014 Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot wine is ripe and spicy. Solid fruit gives a juicy character along with a strong sense of structure. That allows room for plenty of acidity as well as fruit, but also demands aging to allow the mineral texture to soften. Along with owner Monique Bonnet's Château Suau, this vineyard was certified French organic with the 2012 vintage. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Maubert 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Strongly perfumed with new wood, this polished wine is rich, structured and packed with fruit. It has a fine, tannic character balanced by red berry fruit and fine acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Reynon 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A fruity, juicy wine with balanced tannins and red fruits. It is a lively perfumed wine that has some toasty tannins in the background. Drink this ripe wine from 2019. One of five wineries owned by Bernadette Faure and Alain Aubert; their daughters oversee vineyards, winemaking and marketing.
title: Château German 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, smoky wine is structured, full of new oak flavors and dense with both fruit and tannins. Its concentrated, bold blackberry flavors and firm tannins mix with smoky wood notes and acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Roque le Mayne 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, fruity wine has soft tannins and a generous, warm character that makes it already drinkable. Better, however, to wait until its full potential is realized, from 2019.
title: Château du Pitray 2015 Premier Vin  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This 14-acre property overlooking the Garonne river has produced a densely structured wine with impressive tannins and black fruits. Dominated by Merlot, the wine is full of rich black-currant and berry flavors, with balanced acidity. The wine is full, aging well and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Clos Sainte Anne 2015  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From a vineyard that is on the slope right above the river Garonne, this wine has a good mix of richness and black-currant crispness. Its structure is generous, with fully integrated tannins. Ripe and warm while also having balancing acidity, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.
title: Château Réaut 2015  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With 90% Merlot, this is a rich, dense wine. Its alcohol shows in the pepper and rich spice character and in the dark, extracted flavors. Happily, plenty of ripe black-plum fruit from the 130-acre organic estate gives the wine potential balance. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de la Dauphine 2014  Fronsac

description: Rich and spicy, this offers ripe black-currant fruits. toast and plenty of crisp acidity. The wine is full in the mouth and has a good future. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Perron 2016  Graves

description: Winemaker Pierre Lanain and the Stéphane Derenoncourt consultants blended a perfumed wine with rich tannins, weight and concentration. Warm and generous, it has ripe black fruits, juicy acidity and layers of spice and wood-aging flavors. Drink from 2022
title: Château des Fougéres 2016 Clos Montesquieu  (Graves)

description: With strong new wood aromas, this concentrated wine shows vanilla as well as black-fruit flavors. Acidity cuts the richness, giving shape to wine and focusing on the balance. With firm tannins in the background, it needs several years. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut Selve 2010  Graves

description: This wine exhibits the generosity from the ripe 2009 vintage. It has rich, full and round fruits, with a pleasing black currant flavor and tannic edge. Juicy, with a dust-textured aftertaste, this will age for 4-5 years.
title: Château Haut Selve 2009  Graves

description: Here's a big, wood-laden wine that shows some bitterness, extraction and toast influence. However, the weight of ripe black-plum flavor will certainly come forward to produce a balanced, rich bottling, with the generosity of the year. Wait for 2-3 years.
title: Château du Seuil 2009  Graves

description: Bel-Air is owned by the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages in Pauillac, and the pedigree of the winemaking shows. A rich, almost opulent wine, tempered with tannins. Flavors of dark black figs, herbs and wood come together harmoniously. It has a tense edge of tannin that promises aging.
title: Château Villa Bel Air 2003  Graves

description: From the north of the Haut-Médoc, just outside Saint-Estéphe, this wine has a predominance of Cabernet Sauvignon. That yields black-currant fruit and tight tannins. The spice from wood aging will integrate as it matures to give a rich juicy wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This Cru Bourgeois estate has produced a rich, minty and spice-flavored wine. It has ripe tannins and rich blackberry fruits. It is dense, with a firm structure that gives the wine potential. It also has the fruitiness of the year. Together, they will make a fine wine, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A dark-colored wine, this is full of tannins as well as ripe blackberry fruits. The acidity and fruitiness give it a very fresh character, while the underlying tannins will let it age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Agassac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Attractive mint aromas lead to a wine that shows strong wood-aging flavors. These are balanced by the ripe black currant fruits and firm tannins. Taken together, these have produced a rich wine that needs to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This much-improved Château is now performing well, as evidenced by this powerful and tannic wine. Showing ripe fruits, sweet tannins and tight acidity, it has weight, great spice from the wood aging and a deliciously juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Cissac 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a firm wine, showing the tannins of the vintage while also bringing out ripe fruit to balance. It shows tense acidity with a juicy edge and follows through with a sense of potential richness. This has all the  elements for good aging.
title: Château Fontesteau 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Made using fruit selected from old vines, this is a concentrated effort that straddles the old-style Bordeaux and the modern, fruit-driven type.
