title: Château Bardins 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dark in color, this wine is firm, structured and dense. Ripe blackberry fruits dominate the tannins, giving weight and impressive richness for the vintage. The wood-aging is still showing in the dry core, so the wine needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cantin 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Dark fruits, bitter chocolate and black plums all come together in this dense, firm wine that never loses sight of sweetness. Alongside the structure, there is still plenty of juicy fruit that lifts the wine, especially in the aftertaste.
title: Château Grand Destieu 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: This ripe wine offers new-wood mint and spice flavors as well as rich tannins. They are balanced by generous blackberry fruits and juicy acidity to give a full-bodied wine that will age well over the medium term. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2016 Nectar des Bertrands  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich, ripe and full-bodied, this is a Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon/Malbec blend. Juicy acidity and berry fruits are integrated into the firm structure. A smoky, dry wood-laden background gives the wine good texture. Drink from 2016. Xavier Carreau, Alain Jourdan and Cyril Jourdan, the latest generation, run the family's five estates.
title: Château Barbé 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Hand-sorting and 18 months of aging is the key here. This 80% Merlot blend with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc offers a generously proportioned balance of tannins and black fruits. It has full-bodied character, packed with berry fruits and rich acidity. With all these elements, it will develop well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Frédignac 2012 Cuvée Terroir  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This smoky, ripe and structured Gonfrier wine shows good potential, offering fine tannins and rich black fruits. Its structure, concentration and balance already show a wine that will have an excellent future. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Tanesse 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dense young tannins and 18 months in oak dominate the wine, promising a rich future. The fruit weight is all there, ripe blackberry flavors that will come through over the next months. Marie-Dominique and Jean Watrin have been the owners since 1994. Drink this concentrated wine from 2019.
title: Château la Doyenne 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With Merlot and Cabernet Franc dominating the blend, this wine is as perfumed as it is structured. It shows elegance through its rich blackberry fruit and firm tannins. Concentrated and ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château de Brousse 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is full of smoky tannins and ripe black fruits, with a light touch of acidity. It's dense, structured as befits the vintage, and still has a way to go. Set on the slopes above the river Garonne, this is a seriously improved estate, bought by the Dulon family in 2004. Drink from 2016.
title: Château du Vallier 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Produced from selected parcels, this perfumed wine is made for aging. It is solid and dense with mint and rich plum flavors that are still surrounded by the influence of the new barrels used for the aging. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2012 Grand Réserve  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Firm and obviously wood-aged, this ripe wine is full of rich black plum fruits that balance the smoky toasty character. It is dense, a solid wine with good potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Moulin de Guiet 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine, ripe and fruity, is ready to drink. Its tannins and red fruits are moving into a more earthy, mature phase. The wine is still dense and will remain so, giving weight as well as spice and concentration. Drink now.
title: Château de la Riviére 2012  Fronsac

description: With vines close to Pauillac, the estate offers an unusual blend with 50% Petit Verdot. Great butts and intense black fruits as well as an almost black color are the result. The wine is solid, structured and likely to need time to be ready to drink. Keep until 2021.
title: Château Balac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a perfumed wine, with mint flavors as well as blackberry fruits. There is still a dominant structure of tannins and the wood aging that will allow the wine to age well. The fruits give the wine weight while the aftertaste has great swathes of acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Logat 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A strongly wood-aged wine, full of as much spice and toast as fruit. It will probably soften and round out to give a wine that, while firm, will have rich black currant fruitiness, dusty tannins and fresh acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Balac 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: The skill of Michel Rolland's wine-consulting team shows in this sophisticated, rich wine. The 90% Merlot dominates, but the ripeness is tempered by solid tannins, stylish black-currant flavors and a firm, ageworthy aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Courlat 2011  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: Strong spice and burnt wood aromas are followed by high toast flavors. The wine is solid, firm and at this stage just hinting at the ripe fruit underneath, meaning it needs time to open and broaden. Drink this wine with its excellent potential from 2017.
title: Château Bel-Air 2012 Cuvée Jean Gabriel  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: This 23-acre-estate is situated in the south of the Margaux appellation, close to classed growth Château Giscours. While not classified, it still has the ability to produce a fine ripe wine that also has great structure. Acidity and firm tannins are very present along with concentrated blackberry fruits. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Mille-Roses 2012  Margaux

description: A solid effort, with attractive, balanced black currant fruits and ripe acidity. The wine layers fruit and integrated tannins. It feels chunky and dense, finishing dry.
title: Château Ferriére 2009  Margaux

description: A big, rich and juicy wine that is smooth and full of black plum juice flavors. It brings out firm tannins, ripe fruits and a generous texture. It's dense, solid and ready for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château les Grands Chênes 2011  Médoc

description: This ripe wine with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon is solid and firm both with tannins and wood aging. The juicy black currants that shine through reflect the vintage. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Château Escot 2015  Médoc

description: A small estate belonging to the owners of classed growth Croizet Bages, this wine is rich, densely textured and has good potential. It is young: both the tannins and the slight barnyard character testify to that. When it matures, it will be full and concentrated. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Richebon 2015  Pauillac

description: The second wine of Château Duhart Milon in a top year such as 2005 is the equal to many chateau Bordeaux. It has good depth of blackberry and red plum fruits, ripened by sweet acidity, layers of wood and spice, and a great finishing balance.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Moulin de Duhart  (Pauillac)

description: Solid layers of tannin partner with black currant fruit. This is structured, dark and very dry at the moment, although it will give a more rounded character as it ages. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Garde 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This ripe, Merlot-dominated blend is packed with the berry fruits typical of the vintage. There is a spicy edge to this rich wine that offers smooth tannins and a juicy aftertaste. It will age relatively quickly, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Franc Maillet 2014 Cuvée Montille  (Pomerol)

description: The high amount of chalk in the soil of this estate shows in the strongly mineral texture of the wine. With layers of black currant flavors, the wine is fruity while also structured. Its tannins and firm core promise some good aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Vieux Barrail 2015  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Gems like this from the stellar 2000 vintage are still available to consumers willing to explore lesser-known chateaus. Concentrated scents of black cherries and cassis emerge from the glass, followed by admirably pure flavors of black cherries and vanilla. It's supple enough to drink now, but appears to have the stuffing to go another 5-10 years. A long, berry-filled finish caps off this find.
title: Château Laroque 2000  Saint-Émilion

description: Dominated by its 72% Merlot, this wine is soft, ripe and with the smoothness that comes from barrel aging. It is rich, with concentration and generous fruit typical of the vintage. From vines close to the Dordogne river, it is a juicy wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Pontet-Fumet 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: A mix of ripe black fruits and dense tannins characterize this young wine. Its structure is surrounded by rich fruits, smoothly textured and generous. Acidity gives the wine a fresh touch in its aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour de Pressac 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Richly endowed with spice and wood-aging flavors, this is a firm and toasty wine. In many years, the wood would have been too much, but not in this vintage. The black fruit weight will balance with the wood as it ages to give an elegant, juicy wine ready to drink from 2022.
title: Château Haut-Pezat 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: The wine is rich, with firm young tannins as well as generous blackberry fruits. The dry core of the wine will certainly soften as this ripe wine matures. The blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, in almost equal measure, gives the wine its balanced fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Coussieu-Coutelin 2014  Saint-Estéphe

description: With important flavors of new wood, dusty dry tannins and mint, this is a concentrated and powerful wine that also has elegance. It is ripe, rich with balancing acidity, and ready for aging.
title: Château Arnaud 2009  Saint-Estéphe

description: Smooth, open wine, the ripest fruit layered with soft tannins. It reveals all the opulent fruit of the year while offering medium-term pleasure.
title: Château Gloria 2009  Saint-Julien

description: With its dusty tannins and bright fruits, this fully represents the vintage. It has a texture that is open, relatively gentle, powered by black currants and very accessible. The acidity gives a light lift at the end.
title: Château Lagrange 2007  Saint-Julien

description: With a medicinal hint, this is a wine that is all potential. At the moment, it is firm, dry and darkly tannic. The weight gives the promise, offering rich fruitiness in the future. Drink this impressive, concentrated wine from 2016.
title: Château La Croix Lartigue 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Smooth, ripe and immediate, this is a wine that is developing deliciously, but fast. There is a great fresh, juicy character that balances with the ripe, full tannins. Don't age, just enjoy.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: Minty overtones set the scene for a smoothly textured wine that shows rich, super-ripe fruit, blackberry jam flavors and a dense, dusty tannic structure. It is sweet, modern in style, a wine that doesn't want to keep anything back.
title: Château de Candale 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: This tiny four-acre vineyard has produced a warm and juicy wine in this fruity vintage. It is generous, with its smooth 70% Merlot and rich with the tannins of Cabernet Franc. The aftertaste brings out crunchy acidity that will allow the wine to mature further. Drink from 2018.
title: Clos Junet 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: A full and rich wine, this is concentrated in black fruit tones and balanced by structured tannins. Ripe and juicy in feel, it has layers of spice from the wood aging and intense acidity. This powerful wine needs to age; drink from 2021.
title: Château Peyfaures 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Smoky wood flavors dominate this dense, wood-aged wine. It also has juicy red berry flavors and will be generous and very fine when mature. Drink from 2020.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2015 Cuvée Major  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a special Cuvée, produced from the estate of the Prissette family. It is certainly rich and dense but it also has a crisp edge coming from the black-currant fruits. The tannins are still firm and young, underlining the weight of the wine. With a final dry edge, the wine has considerable potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Château du Roc 2014 Libelula  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Owned by the Boissenot family, consultants to four of the five Bordeaux first growths, this estate produces classic Bordeaux. There's nothing flashy, but the wine offers rich tannins and layers of ripe black-currant fruit. It is ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château les Vimiéres 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: From vines owned by Château Giscours but outside the Margaux appellation, this ripe and structured wine is a great success. Its rich berry and black currant fruits are pushed forward by the firm tannins that are so perfectly judged. It's a wine to enjoy soon, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Giscours 2012 Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours  (Haut-Médoc)

description: This estate is part of the Bordeaux winemaking school, giving students the chance to put their hands in the vineyard. The wine, rich and packed with fruit, is exemplary. It is full of berry fruits, generous and with fine, ripe tannins. It will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Dillon 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Finally it looks as if Lascombes is back on form. With its huge vineyard, a good selection of the best fruit has been the issue, and this has happened with 2003. It's not a huge wine, but there is smooth, polished fruit, layered with wood and  dusty tannins. Imported by Diageo Chateau & Estates.
title: Château Lascombes 2003  Margaux

description: If Margaux is the most delicate of the Médoc wines, then this is the epitome of Margaux. It is light, poised and attractively perfumed. The fruit is elegant and fresh with a fine streak of acidity.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2000  Margaux

description: This wine is firm, solid and dense with ripe black fruits. It is structured, with a dry core that needs to round out. However, the main thrust of the wine is towards rich fruitiness and enough tannins, wood flavors and acidity to allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Vieux Robin 2013  Médoc

description: This serious wine is beginning to mature. Its spicy wood and mint flavors are now integrating with the rich structure. The finish is bright in a final burst of fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012 Thomas Barton Réserve Privée  (Médoc)

description: From an eight-acre vineyard, this is produced by the same team as Château Paloumey. Powerful and concentrated, it is also elegant, balancing its structure with good berry fruits and acidity. The tannins are still considerable, so drink from 2017.
title: Château La Garricq 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: 89-91. Barrel sample. This chateau has been newly acquired by the Barton family of Léoville Barton. It's an attractive, fruity wine with warm tannins. The palate is fine and juicy, and finishes softly at the end.
title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: Toast and blackberry aromas set the scene for this ripe, bold, fruity wine. With tannins, spice from wood-aging and a still-firm texture, it's showing its youth, but the rich blackberry fruit and density promise long life ahead. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Roc de Boissac 2014  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Bold and fruity, this wine is rich with smooth tannins and a fine ripe texture. Powered by its structure and its dark fruits, it is a wine for serious aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Fleur Cardinale 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine that comes from river plain vineyards of Saint-Emilion. It has rich tannins and juicy blackberry and black-plum fruits. The structure is comfortably cushioned in the generous texture. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Belle Assise Coureau 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This top Cuvée from Carignan has too much wood. That trait, along with its extracted character, makes it hard to like at this stage. With powerful tannins from superripe Merlot, this is going to take many years to reveal any balance. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Carignan 2014 Prima  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A structured wine from the Chadronnier family, it is full of tannins and also full of sweeping black-fruit flavors. It is perfumed, rich and concentrated. Don't drink until at least 2020 to get the full generosity of the wine.
title: Château Marsau 2014  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This was the last vintage at Clos Fourtet under the ownership of the Lurtons. They made fine wine, but the potential of the property was never quite realized. The wine just fails to excite: it is rich and concentrated with ripe tannins and some sweetness, but at the same time, there is a layer of acidity and structure which gives the wine a firm, solid shape.
title: Clos Fourtet 2000  Saint-Émilion

description: Produced from a selection of grapes, this is a bold, fruity wine that has rich tannins and a generous structure. It is all about the black-fruit flavors with balanced acidity and just hints of toast. It is now a delicious, mature wine from a fine year. Drink now.
title: Château Cantinot 2010 Les Tours de Cantinot  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While this wine is still dense and tannic, it also has great layers of blackberry and black plum fruits that give richness. So although it is structured, it is also full and ripe, hinting at a delicious, generous future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2012 Le Pin de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe, full-throttle wine. It has layers of blackberry and firm, dusty tannins. They are balanced by the juicy texture that gives the wine both freshness and the promise of some further aging. The wine is complex, rich and with good potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château l'Espérance 2012 Les Cédres  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This firm and structured wine also has full-on ripe, jammy fruits. The combination gives weight, richness and structure. A touch of licorice adds an extra dimension to this fruity, firm wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Jeandeman 2010 La Chêneraie  (Fronsac)

description: This is a well structured, rich wine. It has solid, ripe red-berry and black-currant fruits that dominate the firmer tannins, giving a juicy, generous feel. Well worth aging for 3-5 years.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: A solid, chunky structure is the hallmark of this big wine. The fruit is black, full of dark tannins. Perhaps it lacks subtlety, but that is replaced with great power and potential.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2000  Margaux

description: This well-made, ripe wine has a good balance between its fresh black currant fruits and tannins that are already softening. It is a success for the vintage, emphasizing fruit and fresh acidity, and will likely be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Deyrem Valentin 2013  Margaux

description: If anybody could source good fruit in Pauillac, it would be the winemaking team at Lafite-Rothschild. This wine, with its classic black-currant flavors, is structured while full of the ripe fruitiness and rounded character of the vintage. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2015 Légende  (Pauillac)

description: The wine has developed well, with plenty of weight, but the fruit seems a little diffuse, soft, open in character. It's masking the tannin core, a wine that opens slowly and carefully.
title: Château Pavie Macquin 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: Powerful and dense, this has a great balance between the ripe blackberry fruit and the dark, smoky concentrated structure. Along with its equilibrium comes crisp acidity, lending freshness to this solid, firm wine. Age for at least four years.
title: Château Arnaud 2010  Saint-Estéphe

description: The wine comes from a small, seven-acre property. This 2010 is structured with a mineral character and chewy tannins. It is well balanced; the blackberry fruit synchronizes well with the dry texture and fresh acidity. Age for 4-5 years.
title: Château Graves de Pez 2010  Saint-Estéphe

description: Impressively ripe fruit, with smoky flavors from wood, the texture sweet and fleshy. The wine has juicy berry flavors, with the freshest acidity, livened with spice from the fruit and the oak aging. Worth aging for 5-10 years.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2007  Saint-Julien

description: This is a delicate wine with a very Margaux feel. The delicious red berry fruits and light layers of tannin are in balance, suggesting a wine that will age relatively quickly, and is already drinkable now.
title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2009  Margaux

description: This big, fruity black-colored wine has ripe stone fruit flavors and firm, ripe tannins. There is structure, obvious aging potential as well as ripe, sweet juicy Merlot fruit flavors. Age for 5-6 years.
title: Vieux Château des Templiers 2008  Pomerol

description: Dense with tannins, this wine has power and concentration. The tannins are generously paired with rich fruits and acidity. These elements all point to a wine that needs time to mature and release its full power. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2016 Diamant Rouge  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Full and rich, this has intense, ripe black-plum fruit, with layers of wood aging that give the wine a dry, firm character. The Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend give it tannic structure and concentrated juiciness. Age this for at least six years.
title: Château de Reynaud 2010 La Voliére  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Reflecting the structure and fruit of the 2010 vintage, the wine has dry tannins that are balanced by juicy black fruits and fine acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Portets 2010  Graves

description: French philosopher and writer Charles-Louis de Montesquieu once lived at the moated Château de la Bréde, hence the name of this wine. It is a ripe, finely perfumed wine, with new wood and eucalyptus aromas, rich red fruits and a soft, open series of tannins. It is almost ready to drink, but the chocolate edge suggests it should be kept until 2017.
title: Château de la Bréde 2011 Cuvée Montesquieu  (Graves)

description: Owned by Château Larose Trintaudon, this wine comes from the same plateau west of Pauillac. It is well made, bringing out ripe fruit and generous black-cherry flavors, with a touch of spice from wood aging. The tannins are dry, in the background and sufficient to allow the wine to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Arnauld 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a perfumed, fruity and ripely juicy wine. It has jammy red-berry fruits that are shot through with acidity. Dry tannins still come through strongly to set a structure that will allow this well-made wine to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bourseau 2012  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This is a succulent, ripe wine that has powerful black fruits as well as strong flavors of spicy, toasty wood. It is rich in the mouth with hints of perfume from the Cabernet Franc in the blend, aided by consultant Hubert de Boüard of Château Angélus. The aftertaste is both juicy and crisp.
title: Château Sergant 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This wine just escapes having too much wood aging. The spice and wood tannins are very present but still give the powerful black fruits plenty of space. With black-plum-skin tannins and a dense texture, the wine is superripe and needs to age. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Bourseau 2015 La Croix de Bourseau  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Produced from the best parcels of the estate, this is a dense wine that's full of ripe blackberry fruits. It is also firm and structured in a way that will allow it to age. The fruit is all there, solid and ripe and lit by final perfumed acidity. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Château Haut-Piquat 2012 La Fleur de Haut-Piquat  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Already the structure is beginning to make way for ripe plum and damson fruits. With its firm structure, this is a complex and concentrated wine that will need to age over at least four years.
title: Château Haut Bellevue 2010  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: A smooth, polished wine, with acidity, sweet fruit and a range of dusty tannins, with acidity. This is an accomplished, delicious wine that is developing fast, and seems only for medium-term aging.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Close to 100% Merlot, this wine comes from the old vines of this small Pomerol estate. It is rich, still with its tannins intact, and offers a solid burst of ripe black fruits. The wine is still young, still with the first flush of fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Altimar 2012  Pomerol

description: Big, broad and ripe, with an opulent texture, flavors of black plums. along with soft tannins and a smooth surface. The wine is developing well, offering rich fruit that will deepen in a couple of years.
title: Château l'Enclos 2007  Pomerol

description: A well-balanced, structured wine, produced from five acres owned by actor Gérard Depardieu. The tannins are solid, the fruit is black-hued, flavored with figs and plums, but leavened with delicious ripeness, acidity and balance.
title: Confiance 2004  Premieres Cotes de Blaye

description: With vines to the east of Saint-Émilion, this family-owned vineyard has produced a ripe, smooth wine that is powerful and densely tannic. It is full of black plum flavors, a dark structure and hints of the wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Vieux-Guinot 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Powerful and dense, this is already a smooth, rich wine, and its tannins are cushioned by the generous blackberry note. There are mint and tar hints along with a smoke accent from the wood, resulting in a wine that has a dry edge yet is dominated by ripe, juicy fruit.
title: Château Tour de Lagarde 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a finely etched wine with just the right balance between its ripe fruits and tannins. Structured while also juicy, it has a mint and black-currant freshness as well as a dry core that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cossieu Coutelin 2012  Saint-Estéphe

description: Ripe, elegant wine, with great flavors of black currants, plum skin sweetness and firm, etched tannins. Expect this wine to age well, the tannins rounding to give a wine of authority.
title: Château Haut-Saint-Georges 2005  Saint-Georges-Saint-Émilion

description: Under the management of Jean Merlaut, this estate has lost some of the super-opulence of the wines of the 90s, and gained finesse and elegance. That has stood the 2003 in good stead, emphasizing solidity and dry tannins to balance the wood and cranberry flavors of the fruit. Imported by Diageo Chateau & Estates.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2003  Saint-Julien

description: Along with the freshness of 2008, the wine has weight and an excellent tannic character. Powered by juicy fruit, it reveals black currant and damson skins as well as perfumed acidity. Serious, likely to age for 3-4 years.
title: Château Robert 2008  Pomerol

description: Densely tannic and rich, this is full of ripe chocolate and blackberry fruit. It is dark, brooding and dense-a great success for the second wine of Château du Glana.
title: Château du Glana 2009 Terre du Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: Ripe, soft and very drinkable, this has a generous structure that cushions the tannins with rounded black fruits. The acidity and the warm, generous character of the 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc blend net a fine representation of the fruity 2012s. This is Bordeaux consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt's home turf. Wooden fermenters and 16 months in barrel (40% new) necessitate time, so drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de l'A 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A small 10-acre vineyard close to the city of Bordeaux city has created a structured 2008, which is now beginning to mature. The black currant flavor is still dominant, but it has been joined by ripe, soft tannins and a delicious, refreshing layer of acidity, lifted by an herbal edge. Age for another year, but also drink now.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: The second wine of Château Margaux is certainly as good as many crus bourgeois. This vintage is ripe and elegant.  For fruit that is so ripe what is fascinating is the way the wine finishes with acidity and a great lift. Delicious in three to five years. Imported by Diageo Chateau & Estates.
title: Château Margaux 2003 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux  (Margaux)

description: Dense, attractive, sweet, wood-laden wine, with ripe black berry fruits and important fruit tannins. The wine is concentrated, firm, based on great fruit and structure.
title: Château les Vimiéres 2008 Le Tronquera  (Margaux)

description: This wood-aged wine is still finding its way. But its potential richness and dense texture are already there. As it matures, this wine will lose its spiciness and show good balance and great concentration. Drink from 2021.
title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Émilion 2016 Château Marquis de Mons  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This full, generous wine is equally packed with tannins and black fruits. Its richness and density comes partly from the 40-year-old vines and also from the new-wood aging that partners with the ripe fruits. This wine, dominated by 90% Merlot, will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Château Tour Saint Christophe 2015 La Croix Saint-Christophe  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Fruit and more mature flavors are coming together, giving a structured wine with black-currant flavors balanced with mint, spice and a rounded texture. This stylish wine is almost ready to drink; just wait until summer 2016.
title: Château de l'Annonciation 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: The second wine of Saint-Émilion premier cru classé Trottevieille is full of fruit while also having plenty of structure. It shows signs of becoming a delicious, fresh wine with attractive tannins and red-berry fruits. Developing well, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Trottevieille 2013 Dame de Trottevieille  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This very complete wine offers dark tannins, ripe berry fruits and a velvet texture. It's rich, relying on blackberry and black plum flavors and a dense structure. Mouth-filling, it delivers delicious fragrant acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laforge 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: A blend of 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this is a rich, spicy and perfumed wine. Layers of wood aging accompany ripe blackberry fruits and dark tannins. The texture is dense and dark, still developing. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Révérence 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a firm wine with ripe Merlot fruits that are still sheathed in tannins. Densely textured, it is rich with berries and a stalky character that needs to soften. Wait for this solid, concentrated and ageworthy wine until 2017.
title: Château de l'Annonciation 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: It shows great depth of flavor, with delicious fresh berries, black fruits, balanced acidity and fragrance. The tannins are present, but given a great lift by the fruitiness. A wine to drink over the medium-term, from 2016.
title: Château Laforge 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: A big, rounded and ripe wine that is balanced and solidly tannic. With its layers of structured Merlot fruit and tannins, it is naturally a rich black fruited wine. The acidity gives great fruitiness to counterpoint the firm tannins. Drink from 2017. DHI Selections and Victoire Imports.
title: Château du Val d'Or 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Dominated by juicy Merlot, the wine has weight, density and a full, fruity blackberry character. This generosity is balanced by a restraining dry, tannic core.
title: Château Laforge 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: An elegant wine that has some maturity, even though the tannins are still firm. It shows considerable fresh acidity, giving a fresh feel to the black currant fruits. Light spiciness adds extra interest. It's ready to drink now and until 2022.
title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2008  Pomerol

description: A selection of Merlot from Château Robert, this is a concentrated, solid wine. It is still young, with its firm structure and juicy acidity still right up front. Black currant, smoky spice and red berry freshness combine with the aging potential of the dry core. Age for 4-5 years.
title: Château Robert 2008 Château Tour Robert  (Pomerol)

description: Rich and firmly structured, this shows ripe berry and currant notes. It is dense and juicy, layered with wood notes and loaded with sweet tannins. Like many wines from Montagne-Saint-Émilion, it offers good value.
title: Château La Bastienne 2010  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: The old vines of the Laride estate go into this wine. Serious wood aging has given a dark-toast and bitter-chocolate character that currently masks the rich blackberry and black-plum fruits. The wine needs time. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Laride 2014 L'Iris de Laride  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Almost half-and-half Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this soft, ripe and fruity wine is open and ready to drink. It has some toast that is mainly integrated with the black-currant flavors. As the wine opens, richness, spice and acidity all come together. Drink now.
title: Château Pas de l'Ane 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Owned by the Trocard family since 1628, this vineyard has produced a rich and rounded 2010. Dominated by Merlot, it is solid, concentrated and ripe. Acidity cuts through the richness to give a full and fruity character at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Laborde 2010 Cuvée 1628  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: One of the many properties in Moulis with Poujeaux in its name, this estate has produced a classic, elegant wine, its Cabernet Sauvignon element providing a delicious black currant flavor, rounded out by the Merlot. Firm tannins still point the wine in the direction of aging, so give it four years and more.
title: Château la Graviére Grand Poujeaux 2010  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This is a very modern style of wine, with generous new wood and super-ripe fruit flavors, balancing with polished solid tannins. Very international in style, it is good, but could come from anywhere.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2000  Pauillac

description: This small Pauillac property, close to Château Pontet-Canet, has produced an impressive 2006, structured with firm tannins under the black currant fruit.
title: Château Béhéré Courtin 2006  Pauillac

description: A wine with great density. Along with firm tannins, this has a dark and chunky character. Under the tannins, great swathes of fruit surge through the tannins, bringing out black-currant-juice flavors.
title: Château Lagrave 2010  Pomerol

description: Modern style of wine, with hints of polished wood, mint flavors and a strong sense of structure. Along with the blackberry fruit, still showing no signs of age, the wine has concentration and elegance. It's a wine for more aging over another 4-5 years.
title: Château Moulin de Grillet 2005 Les Ailes du Moulin  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: This Grand Cru Classé, with its 25% Cabernet Franc, is rich and opulently textured. It brims with ripe berry fruits, plus dense tannins that are supple and well integrated. Still developing, it's full in the mouth and is becoming a generous wine, more fruit than long-term structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Cap de Mourlin 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine, produced by the team of Château du Glana, is big, bold, solid and very firmly structured. With weight, richness, black plum skins and dark tannins, it's a fine wine for aging, so give it at least 6-7 years.
title: Château du Glana 2010 Terre du Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: Already well developed, this solid, wood-aged wine packs powerful tannins as well as fruit. It has a dense character, spice and a core of firmness. With its rich fruit and fresh acidity at the end, it's nearly ready to drink but merits a wait. Drink from 2016.
title: Clos Cantenac 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Made up of several different parcels scattered across the Margaux appellation, the Château now has 24 acres. This 2012 is structured while also full of ripe fruit. The tannins lie behind the juicy red fruitiness and the immediately attractive ripe flavors. It should age, but not for long. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Marsac Séguineau 2012  Margaux

description: Grapes from 40-year-old vines make up the bulk of this wine, giving it structure, concentration and weight. Densely wrought, its black fruit is still suppressed by wood and fruit tannins. The balance will come, giving an elegant wine in 3-4 years.
title: Château Grand Tayac 2010  Margaux

description: A powerful and rich wine, it features black plum fruits, sweet while solid tannins and a dense structure. With its fruitiness masked by the structure, it will need time to smooth out and show its ripe, full-bodied character. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Mancédre 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: With considerable new wood flavors, this is a ripely opulent wine. It has weight, rich tannins, a smooth surface as its skims over the black fruits. The acidity, sweet black plum jelly, both give a warm, ripe character to the wine.
title: Château Tour Baladoz 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: From a small parcel close to Château Tour Blanche, this delicious, rich but fresh Cabernet Sauvignon has structured fruit, concentration and exuberant blackberry acidity and balanced, solid tannins from the wood.
title: Bernard Magrez 2004 Magrez Tivoli  (Médoc)

description: The Despagne family returned to tradition with the making of Girolate, planting a vineyard to the former high density, keeping winemaking simple. This is the 2003, the latest release. Reflecting the heat of that vintage, it is soft, textured, rich and spicy, with a southern warmth. Pure superripe Merlot.
title: Girolate 2003  Bordeaux

description: Generous berry fruits emerge slowly from the firmly tannic front to this wine. The potential for balance and structure is there, with great fruit and ripe tannins. At the end, the wine has acidity and a fresh aftertaste. This Merlot/Cabernet Franc blend is from Marcel Verfaillie's 17-acre property purchased in 2007. Oenologist Jean-Marc Domme runs the estate with consultant Thomas Duclos.
title: Château la Nauze 2012 Premium  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From the vineyard associated with the hotel of the same name and owned by the Cazes family of Lynch-Bages, this is a dense Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine. It has power and structure, its black fruits on the dry side, concentrated and ready for aging. It should be kept at least four years.
title: Château Cordeillan-Bages 2008  Pauillac

description: 89-91. Barrel sample. At 29 acres, this is a large vineyard for Pomerol. The 2012 is a ripe, open wine with spice, sweet tannins and a soft, full character. Ripe and spicy on the finish.
title: Clos René 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: An elegant wine, this is lightly perfumed with a fine smoky flavor, which accompanies the generous notes of black fruits. The wood influence still shows prominently and needs a few years to integrate, but the wine now is exuberant, full bodied and replete with fruit.
title: Château Pierhem 2009  Pomerol

description: Dark, bitter chocolate flavors come together with dusty tannins, new wood and smoky aromas. Despite a slight vegetal hint, the main effect is elegance, with a smooth aftertaste.
title: Château Pape Clément 2004  Pessac-Léognan

description: This sweet-tasting, fruity wine features a delicious, fragrant, juicy blackberry flavor. Its tannins are solid, but they are secondary to the generous fruits.
title: Château Valandraud 2009 Virginie de Valandraud  (Saint-Émilion)

description: An elegant wine that is given weight by its rich black fruits and style by the balance between tannins and acidity. There is a fresh character to this bright and fruity wine at this stage. Give it 4-5 years and it will begin to develop secondary aromas. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Chantelune 2011  Margaux

description: A wine that certainly has excellent balance despite the wood that dominates the aromas. The flavors are dry, with tannins as the strongest element. What's underneath the fruit is still waiting to show through.
title: Clos de la Vieille Eglise 2005  Pomerol

description: A big, sweet, soft wine, with attractive ripe blackberry fruits. It's lively, smoky and licorice flavored, with delicious fresh acidity to finish.
title: Château d'Armailhac 2005  Pauillac

description: Right next door to Mouton Rothschild, this small property is producing wines that are dominated by the rich, firm Cabernet Sauvignon of Pauillac. The weight and density are very present, a solid dry core surrounded by delicious black currant fruits. A wine that will mature relatively fast because of the vintage.
title: Château Béhéré Courtin 2011  Pauillac

description: The Despagne family returned to tradition with the making of Girolate, planting a vineyard to the former high density, keeping winemaking simple. This is the 2004, the latest release. Reflecting the heat of that vintage, it is soft, textured, rich and spicy, with a southern warmth, pure superripe Merlot.
title: Girolate 2004  Bordeaux

description: This is a succulent wine, with juicy red fruits and a fine structure that gives the wine its texture. Balanced and ready to drink, the wine (which is made in tiny quantities) is a fine mature Bordeaux.
title: Domaine Roses Camille 2008  Pomerol

description: A smooth wine, rich for the vintage, with black currant and bright fruits and a strong underlay of wood. The acidity, though, is quite striking, with the freshest fruit and tight tannins.
title: Château Ausone 2007 La Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

description: If not the best, then one of the best kosher wines we've ever tasted, with smoke, cedar and meat aromas nicely balanced by plummy, chocolaty fruit. A creamy mouthfeel and smooth, easy finish makes it a delight to drink, but consume this Merlot-based wine over the near term. Imported by Royal Wine Corporation.
title: Château Valandraud 2002 Kosher  (Saint-Émilion)

description: With its vineyard mix of gravel and sand soil, this wine is poised between structure and a smooth, rich texture. The result is a balanced wine that has both dry tannins and a crisp edge of black currant fruitiness. Drink this ripe wine from 2022.
title: Château Abelyce 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This rich and integrated wine is full of ripe berry fruit and firm tannins. It is a full, concentrated wine, densely textured and structured. There is a good sense of juiciness behind the youthful, firm surface. Give this fine, great-value wine at least four years.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is closed at this stage, offering just hints to its potential. At the core, there are ripe stone fruits, dark plums as well as blackberries. Fine and stylish tannins add balance. This is a fine wine with a future. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Cagnas 2011  Bordeaux

description: This wine is rich, spicy and full of black fruit. With solid tannins alongside its juicy black currant flavors, it's firm and will age well. Its density and richness are developing and will be best from 2020.
title: Château Cap Saint-Martin 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold tannins, rich wood flavors and equally rich black fruits have produced a powerful wine. Its richness and concentration are going to give an impressive wine as it develops. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine that has both firm tannins and ripe black plum fruits. It is concentrated and serious, the wood aging and the fruit tannins giving a lift and richness to the spicy fruit. The estate, dating to the 17th century, has 96 acres. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Sénéjac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Densely tannic while also fruity, this is a product of ripe fruits that give a black currant flavor as well as a solid structure. The acidity gives great lift to the end of this finely made wine.
title: Château Chantemerle 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Initially firmly tannic, this opens to reveal fine blackberry fruit and fresh acidity. It's a generous wine, the wood aging giving tannins and spice while the delicious fruit offers a rounder, smoother side. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Les Grands Maréchaux 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Harvested under the direction of the Dubourdieu sons, this smoky wine is ripe, full of rich juicy fruit as well as firm tannins. A layer of strong black fruits is balanced by acidity. This rich, deliciously fruity wine has a fine future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Reynon 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Warm and ripe, this is a delicious, structured wine from a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot from Stéphane Dupuch. It has fine tannins that give a spicy character aided by 14 months in French oak as well as bold black fruits that are developing well. The acidity at the end adds the freshness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Sainte-Marie 2014 Alios  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Bold tannins and ripe fruit are the hallmarks of this rich wine from the Nicolas Thienpont range. A solid structure backs up the ripe black-currant flavors. The wine will certainly age well, so wait until 2021.
title: Les Charmes Godard 2016 Château La Prade  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The fifth-generation Filliatreaus are working the estate's Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon well. Bold tannins are balanced by rich blackberry flavors in this wine. The combination gives it a fine future, rich, concentrated and dense. Acidity at the end adds the necessary lift. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Beaumont Les Pierriéres 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big and juicy, this is an attractive blend of 70% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Malbec with a promising future. It has ripe berry fruits, touches of spice and ginger. The tannins are firm, dusty and dry while allowing plenty of room for the fruit. It will develop well; drink from 2018.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2012 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A dark colored wine, with aromas of wood and black fruits. Dense,   concentrated, quite dry, but powerful and ripe at the same time, it is a very complete with wine good complex acidity as well as dry tannins and rich fruit. The effect is traditional in style, but the tradition has been modernised.
title: Château l'Hoste-Blanc 1999  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: In 1999, Stéphane and Paola Gabard resurrected winemaking at an estate that has belonged to the family since the 18th century. Ripe, rich and still retaining its youthful structure, this concentrated wine will need time. With its dense texture and layers of black-currant fruit, it has a fine future. Drink from 2019.
title: Château La Gabarre 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This balanced, ripe and full-bodied wine has good concentration and fine tannins that come from the wood aging and the juicy black fruit. It's an impressive wine, for aging 4-6 years.
title: Château de Seguin 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firm and concentrated, this wine has ample weight and aging potential. Dry tannins are balanced by ripe berry fruit, juicy acidity and solid structure. Give this dense wine at least five years.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A concentrated wine from the Pitray family, who fought in the American Revolution, this has bold tannins and the potential for rich fruit. A powerful wine, it shows plenty of spice as well as ripe black-currant flavors and acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Pitray 2016 Premier Vin  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine has serious tannins and firm fruit that give an austere character at this stage. But it will develop and round out into a rich wine with ripe black fruits, always with a solid tannic structure. Owner Juliette Bécot manages the technical side here with consultant Jean-Philippe Fort from the Michel Rolland lab, and manages marketing at classed-growth Château Beauséjour-Bécot in nearby Saint-Émilion.
title: Château Joanin Bécot 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a very complete wine, with all the fruit and tannin elements in place. There's a fine and rich character here as well as a more austere, mineral side. The combination results in supporting tannins, dark fruits and good aging potential.
title: Château Haut Dina 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A big, dark and perfumed wine, with a good density of ripe fruits, powerful tannins and layers of spice, acidity and red jelly. It balances weight with freshness to great effect.
title: Château Suau 2009  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Equally divided between Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with a seasoning of Cabernet Franc, this richly perfumed wine is juicy and full of blackberry flavors. From the same ownership as Cambon la Pelouse and in the southern Haut-Médoc, the wine will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Trois Moulins 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This is fruity and juicy with good acidity and fresh berry fruits. The 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon blend has the right amount of tannic character, showing structure that brings out ripe red fruits and indicates good potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Clairac 2012 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Produced at one of several estates owned by negociant Cheval Quancard, this wine's 12 months in wood has resulted in a spicy wine with a strong core of tannins. The vintage has supplied bold black fruits and a ripe structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe and spicy wine from owner Sophie Holzberg that has tannins as well as rich black fruits. It has a concentrated backdrop that is dry and firm. Full, perfumed and generous, it will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Franc Cardinal 2014  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big and powerful, this is a concentrated and complex wine. Blackberry fruit flavors are strongly based on a tannin structure that is lightly sustained by the wood aging. Merlot dominates the blend, giving a sheen to its richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This bold, ripe wine is full of tannins as well as great fruit. Juicy with black currant flavors, smoky from wood aging and rich with tannins, it's finely structured and ready to mature gently. Drink from 2021.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2015 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and juicy, this fruity wine from an estate with a vibrant history from the 1700s has warmth and rich tannins. Merlot-dominated blackberry and black-plum fruits are allied to a tight structure that promises a fine future. This will age well, so drink from 2022.
title: Château de Belcier 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Still young and showing its wood aging, this wine has great potential. With ripe tannins, spice and generous red fruits, this Merlot-dominated wine is structured while also richly fruity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château la Graviére 2016 Cuvée les Terrasses  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This is a powerfully tannic wine from a blend of equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with a serious touch of Petit Verdot. It is dark in color, dense in texture although with no hint of toughness. Instead, it is a rich wine that will age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Pontoise Cabarrus 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by the Bernard family who also own one of the major Bordeaux negociants, Millésima, the wine is structured, deliciously fruity and with a series of smoky tannins that will allow it to age. It comes from a vineyard close to Pauillac and that shows in the dense Cabernet Sauvignon that gives the wine its weight. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Peyrabon 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Part of the same estate as the Margaux Mongravey but just outside the appellation line, de Braude shares something of the Margaux character. This 2012 is dense and concentrated, with powerful red and black berry flavors. Packed with both fruit and ripe tannins, it needs to age, so wait until 2017.
title: Château de Braude 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: From the southern part of the Haut-Médoc, this effort is rich and rounded, full of black fruits and sweet tannins. It is well balanced, with its acidity and smoky flavors coming through slowly as the wine opens. Age this over many years.
title: Château de Braude 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Next door to, and under the same ownership as, Grand Cru Classé Château Laroque, Peymouton has produced a rich wine that has layers of tannins as well as elegantly perfumed fruit. Acidity and a dark texture give the wine its potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Peymouton 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: An immediately attractive, perfumed wine with fine tannins and rich berry fruits, this has great potential. It is full, ripe and will age well. Just wait until 2022.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2016 La Bergeronnette Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Richly balanced, this ripe, black-fruit -lavored wine has a good future. Its dark texture and generous tannins promise much, backed up by fresher acidity. Drink this Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Château Clairac 2016 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a complex wine, rich in both tannins and dense fruit. It is concentrated, with juicy berry flavors and balanced acidity to go with the solid structure. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Saint Antoine 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Vineyards that slope steeply down from this dramatic medieval castle provide this rich wine. With dense tannins and layers of black currant and acidity, the wine is rich while also elegant, punching well above its appellation. Its structure and acidity mean it needs to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Camarsac 2015 Sélection Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich, smoky and with ripe fruits, this is a powerful wine from vines bordering the Garonne river. Its tannins, swathes of blackberry and black-plum flavors and concentration all point to the need for aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Marsan 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Balanced and ripe, this is a rich wine. Its tannins and dark chocolate and wood flavors are deliciously balanced by ripe black fruit. It's concentrated and dense and will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Tanesse 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This attractive, juicy wine is full of red fruit. It has strawberry and crisp red currant flavors as well as fine acidity. The result is a wine with good balance, richness, spice and tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2015 Cuvée Les Ormeaux  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This smoky wine already shows a fine balance between oak, spice and bright red fruit. It's structured to age but is also attractive now; its juicy berry flavors show easily through the tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Suau 2015  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Gironville is in the southern Haut-Médoc, close to Margaux, and is capable of producing the same style of wine-open and not overly tannic. At the same time, the black currant fruit is present, concentrated and already juicy. This shows fine potential, so keep it for the next 4-5 years.
title: Château de Gironville 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: This 17th-century estate is on the plateau of Lussac, with 12 acres of silica and clay soil. The wine has a smoky edge along with perfumes from the Cabernet Franc in the blend. Its berry flavors, ripe tannins and cinnamon touch are rich and promise some good aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Haut la Greniére 2015  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: Powered by considerable tannins, this Merlot-based wine is firm and concentrated. Its fruit shows intense black plum skin and berry flavors that push through the dark structure. It's a rich wine that needs time. Drink from 2018.
title: Château des Landes 2010 Cuvée Tradition  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a firm, rich expression of the vintage. It has firm tannins, with a mineral edge and a black currant flavor. The wine, which takes part of its name from the gravelly soil, has a toasty wood character that plays a fine supporting role. Age for five years or more.
title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2010  Médoc

description: Rich, wood-aged wine, smooth and ripely fruity. Aromas of mint lead to the polished, ripe, elegant fruit, the tannins surrounded by a comfortable fruit texture. It will age over 4-5 years.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2009 Elegance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Jean-Louis Despagne has made a deep, dark-colored wine from his flagship property. It is polished and smooth, with rich fruit that is still dominated by wood at this stage, but with powerful dark fruit flavors underneath. This is a wine with great intensity and the chance to age for at least 10 years.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2000 Cuvee Passion Bordeaux Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: Packed with tannins, this is a dark, dense wine. Its impressive structure frames rich blackberry and plum fruits. Let this wine age for several years and don't drink before 2022.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2016 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This richly structured wine is powered by its tannins and ripe black fruits. The concentration of its structure is impressive, with a rich density to the black-plum flavors. This is a wine for aging, ready to drink from 2023.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Château Fortuneau  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Minty wood flavors underline the fruitiness of this ripe wine. Structured and concentrated, it has density and some fine acidity to balance. Its fruit is backed by tannins that suggest a good future. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tertre de Belvés 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: It combines rich fruit and complex layers of wood and tannin. A concentrated wine, it's packed with ripe berry fruits, touches of licorice and dark chocolate. A wine for aging, it needs to wait until 2018.
title: Château Malescasse 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a ripe wood-aged wine drawn from a selection of barrels. Eucalyptus flavors go with the black fruits and solid tannins. The wine is dense, and still obviously very young. It is going to be an impressive ripe wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2014 Grand Réserve  (Médoc)

description: This is a fruity, Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine, with tannins that support and balance the black currant flavor. Wood aging lightly brushes the structure.
title: Château Chantelys 2010  Médoc

description: New wood aromas set the scene for this ripe, fuity and toasty wine. It has plenty of black plum fruit, rich tannins and a dry core that will soften. The texture is polished and ripe. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Ricaud 2015 Quartet  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Although full of fruit, this no-sulfur-added wine is structured and concentrated. Big tannins back up the ripe character and generous fruit flavors. It's likely to be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2015 Cuvée Non-Sulfité  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Generous and opulent, this is a wood-aged wine in which the fruit plays a delicious part. Blackberry juice and acidity play counterpoint to toasty wood flavors and dark tannins. There is a fine, toasty aftertaste that promises good aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Chateau Couronneau 2011 Cuvée Pierre de Cartier  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe fruit, new wood flavors and a rounded character give this structured and textured wine a fine sense of shape. It has weight, richness and a well balanced texture. Age it for four years.
title: Château La Rame 2011 La Charrulle  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This concentrated wine is solid with tannins. The fruit is evident from the fine acidity and hints of black plum that push through the wall of tannin. Give it time and drink from 2021.
title: Château de Birot 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From the Moueix family of Pétrus, this is a beauty that shows off all that's good in Right Bank Merlot-dominated wines. Luscious and crammed with succulent plummy fruit, there's so much full-bodied warmth here that you can't stop drinking it once you start. A model of food-friendly, elegant wine.
title: Château Canon de Brem 1996  Canon-Fronsac

description: Ripe and rich, with some firm tannins, this wood-aged wine has a good future. It offers plenty of black fruits backed by the structure and with a solid, juicy fruitiness at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Brisson 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Part of the von Neipperg holdings, this ripe, perfumed wine is rich with tannins and and spice. Black fruits and acidity balance all this firmness to give a wine with delicious potential. Drink this generous Merlot-Cabernet Franc wine from 2021.
title: Château d'Aiguilhe 2016 Seigneurs d'Aiguilhe  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A structured wine, rich in both tannins and fruit, this wine gives a solid performance. Its black and red berry fruits are already balanced with the tannins, while the acidity lends a delicious lift. Delicious now, but best to wait until 2015.
title: Château Tertre de Belvés 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Touches of new wood give this wine a perfumed, minty character as well as weight and concentration. It is a rich Merlot-dominated wine from Jean-François Rontein's Capian slope vines, with a firm character that points up the need for aging. The dry core allied to the ripe tannins suggest the wine will not be ready before 2022.
title: Château la Chéze 2016  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rounded, full wine is densely packed with fruit, but also tannins that add balance. Blackberry flavors come through the dry structure to give both richness and freshness. The aftertaste is ripe, juicy and delicious. Drink now, but best from 2015.
title: Château le Doyenne 2011  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A solid, structured wine from the Despagne family, packed with ripe fruits and some fine yet dense tannins. With its wood character, this finely textured wine is obviously ready for some good aging.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine from Sophie Holzberg has fine tannins, rich fruit and excellent potential. Its solid structure and concentration indicate the richness and density of the vintage. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2016  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This will be a fine wine, with rich tannins and ripe fruits. Tannins and black-plum flavors abound in a wine that has weight and the potential to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Brondelle 2017  Graves

description: Low yields have produced a concentrated wine. The tannins are powerful and dense-a fine foil to the ripe juicy black-currant fruit. The impressive wine is going to take its time to be ready to drink with richness and tight structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: In the south of Haut-Médoc, near Bordeaux, Paloumey has been revived as a vineyard in the last 20 years. This 2012 is full of ripe black fruits, aged in new wood with its mint flavors. It has a good tannic structure, so it will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Paloumey 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: An impressive wine, it already shows signs of its potential. It is elegant, with ripe fruits and layers of dark tannins. As it opens, blackberry fruits come through strongly, balancing the firm structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Beaumont 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Mint aromas and new wood flavors mark this smoothly ripe, polished wine. It has a good amount of black fruit, a dry but open texture and a rich, smoky character. The tannins and generous fruit power the wine forward.
title: Château la Tonnelle 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Liversan is the flagship of the properties owned by the Lapalu family. In 2010 it has produced a complex, tannic and dark-fruit-driven wine that is full, ripe and solidly structured. Rich, with a dry core, it has the potential to age for at least 5-6 years.
title: Château Liversan 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: There is a fine mineral texture to this structured, firm wine from the northern Haut-Médoc. It also has ripe fruit and a richly tannic character, with flavors of black plum juice and berry. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this will age over several years.
title: Château Landat 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: Vines with an average age of 30 years give this wine good intensity that balances the firm, dark tannins. It's a powerful, concentrated Merlot-based wine, big and generous. Ripe plums and berries show strongly through the tannic structure. Give this wine until 2017 before drinking.
title: Château des Arnauds 2012 Cuvée des Capucins  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: With 135 acres under vine, this is a large estate. The high percentage of Merlot in the blend gives this rich wine its ripe blackberry smoky fruits. It is juicy and really fruity with just enough tannin to give the wine shape. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Greysac 2014  Médoc

description: Full, ripe and juicy, this has a flavor of fresh black-currant juice, which is balanced by the dry, firm tannins that promise aging.
title: Château des Lattes 2010  Médoc

description: This vast, 360-acre estate has produced a rich, generous wine in 2015. Its berry fruits are bold, ripe, full bodied and lifted by acidity. The wood aging (12 months) is very present but not at all excessive. Since it needs some time, drink from 2023.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2015  Médoc

description: Owned by the Pagés family, this rich wine is dense and structured. It has layers of dusty tannins and full black-currant fruit from the 60% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink this firm wine with great fruit from 2023.
title: Château la Valiére 2015  Médoc

description: Dating to before the French Revolution, this estate produces some rich, generous wines. This vintage is in that mold, with its rounded black fruits, crisp acidity and solid core of dry tannins. The structure will allow the wine to age, giving great potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Panigon 2015  Médoc

description: Full, ripe and roundly fruity, this is a good example of the natural opulence of 2009. It has rich black fruits, soft tannins, a dark hint of wood and generous richness. Powered by both its acidity and its structure, it is developing well. Drink from 2014.
title: Château de Malengin 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: A half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend, this wine is richly structured and packed with fruit. It has a perfumed character, juicy with blackberry flavors and acidity. Drink this opulent Patrick Meynard wine from 2024.
title: Château Pomeys 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Firm with ripe tannins and layers of blackberry fruits, this richly structured wine comes from one of the highest slopes in the Queyrens family vineyards. It has the ripeness of the vintage along with aging potential, offering plenty of concentration for the future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pilet 2016 Prestige Cabernet Sauvignon  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is produced from organically grown grapes grown outside the Saint-Émilion appellation. It is ripe, smooth and full of generous, soft black fruits. Drink from late 2018.
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2015 Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a ripe, smoky wine with fine tannins and rich black fruit. Dense with black chocolate and damson flavors, it gives concentration and richness and will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château La Rame 2015 La Charmille  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is ripe and packed with fruity Merlot. It has a dense structure and an opulent character that gives the wine considerable richness. The firm tannins are cushioned by all this fruit. It does have high alcohol, but the final acidity ensures that the wine remains crisp.
title: Château Fongaban 2015  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe and balanced, this rich, structured, mostly Merlot wine offers fine tannins and layers of berry fruits. Concentrated and dense, the wine will develop well, with plenty of fruitiness as well as a firm structure. Drink this Vignobles Bayle Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Château Pardaillan 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has bold tannins, generous fruit and an excellent future. With its concentration and density, it needs time to soften. For now, the black fruit flavors are developing well, balanced with acidity and ripe tannins. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Birot 2015 Vintage  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While this wine is concentrated with firm tannins, the rich fruit dominates. It is dark, complex and rich, filled with black-plum flavors and a good structure. Intense juiciness character complements the tannins, giving a ripe wine that can age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2013 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)

description: New-wood aromas stand out strongly in this prestige Cuvée from Mayne-Vieil. On the palate, they are integrating well into the rich berry fruits and ripe, lush texture. The wine needs to age and will be better from 2016.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2012 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)

description: This perfume wine is rich in blackberry flavors. Its tannins are already well defined and in balance with the ripe fruitiness. This full, smoky wine has a great future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Beau-Site 2016  Graves

description: The second wine from this estate with its moated medieval castle is finely structured while showing all the delicious fruit of this vintage. It has spice, some firm tannins and juicy black-currant fruitiness. It will develop well and relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château d'Agassac 2015 Château Pomiés-Agassac  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Now at its peak, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. It has a fine blend of dark tannins and dense plum and berry fruits. Maturing well, the wine is well balanced, with a smoky edge and still with a touch of acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2010  Listrac-Médoc

description: The 2001 is rich, dense, concentrated, with dusty tannins and solid black fruits. The palate is rich and spicy, with new wood flavors supporting firm, ripe fruit. The wine is still young, with dry fruit tannins and a layer of acidity, and excellent potential.
title: Château Siran 2001  Margaux

description: A ripe full-bodied wine that has great structure and fine tannins. The bold red fruits are right to the front. It is a wine with great potential, generous tannins and the acidity of the vintage beautifully balanced. This wine will develop well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This marks the first vintage of this Moulis estate under the ownership of the Barton family of Léoville Barton. Already the wine is showing breeding and an understated structure and richness. Lightly perfumed, full of black fruits and integrated tannins, it should age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Perfumed wood and black fruit aromas lead the way in this delicious wine. It's rich but still firm, with fine juicy fruit that will come through with time. Packed with tannins, it will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Picoron 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A structured wine from Denis Dubourdieu Domaines, this offers black fruits that are developing well. Rich, smoky, full of tannins and berry flavors, the wine is fleshy and well endowed. Drink from 2022.
title: Clos Floridéne 2016  Graves

description: One of the largest vineyards in the Médoc and just outside Pauillac, this estate is also one of the most reliable. This vintage is finely structured with just the right amount of tannin to support the black and red-berry fruits. Fruity and juicy, it should be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This Cru Bourgeois estate has produced a structured wine that is still showing strong wood-aging flavors. Toasty as well as ripely fruity, it has firm tannins and good aging potential. The aftertaste is fruity and spicy. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Pey 2014  Médoc

description: Firm, dry and with solid tannins, this wine still has space for attractive black fruits. The two elements will soften to give a wine with structure and impressive richness. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2016 Bruignac Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firm tannins and a dark, dense character make this wine from the Armand family, for the moment, all about structure. However, it has fruit weight and the hints of black currants will become stronger. Drink from 2022.
title: Château La Rame 2016 La Charmille  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This opulent wine is full of ripe tannins and soft fruit. It is powered by its spiciness, just the right amount of wood and a layer of acidity. Finely structured, it's worth aging for the next 3-4 years.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2011  Fronsac

description: A 50-50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has produced this fruity, juicy while also structured wine. It has concentration with layers of wood aging to support and fill out the fruit. It is still developing- still a young wine. Give it until 2018.
title: Château Labat 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A wine that is rich in both tannins and ripe fruit. The 45% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives the concentration of the wine, with spice and black berry fruits that are given an extra richness by the intense dark plums. The wine needs aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut-Logat 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a rich wine still dominated by solid, firm and dry tannins. Its black and red fruits are ripe and juicy, and its freshness comes from acidity that appears on the finish. Age this balanced effort for 4-5 years, at least.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château Gramond  (Haut-Médoc)

description: A powerful, ripe wine with great sweet tannins, piled with black fruits, a dense texture and layers of wood. Despite all the richness, it still retains a sense of structured balance, finishing with good Bordeaux dryness and acidity.
title: Château Soudars 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: Always one of the star crus bourgeois, Chasse-Spleen has produced a 2003 that manages to combine the rich, ripe fruits of the year with the right tannins and sweetness, along with blackberry fruits. It has the elegance and delicacy of Moulis, as well as some good intensity of flavor. A wine that will certainly age for 10 years or more.
title: Château Chasse-Spleen 2003  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This rich, ripe wine is also balanced. Named after the Saint-Émilion classed-growth estate Château la Gaffeliére (although no longer produced by that estate), the wine has great style and plenty of black-currant acidity as well as generous tannins. Drink from 2022.
designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére Sélection d'Excellence
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2016 Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére Sélection d'Excellence  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The wine, with its 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, is solidly structured with plenty of the firmness that is characteristic of young Saint-Estéphe. To go with this structure, the wine is also full of perfumed black fruits that are already delicious. It will be a rich serious wine as it develops over the next several years. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2014  Saint-Estéphe

description: Big, bold fruits and tannins are already coming into balance in this concentrated wine. It revels in the richness of the vintage and also its structure. Acidity breaks through the tannins and berry fruits to add freshness at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Métairie Neuve 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Producer Cyril Trias works with Alliance Bourg cooperative on this Merlot-dominated wine. It is ripe with rich blackberry fruits. It has spice, a dry core of tannins and a touch of chocolate. With its wood, juicy fruit and acidity, it will develop well and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Chantemerle 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A big, ripe and juicy wine packed with black fruit notes and laced with acidity. The tannins offer a contrast to the fruitiness, bringing balance and structure. This is an impressive wine, the smoky aftertaste bringing out the wood aging.
title: Château Manon la Lagune 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is full of all the right elements, from juicy acidity to black currant fruit and a supporting layer of tannins. It has weight, concentration and delicious spice and berry flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Chantemerle 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is ripe and juicy, with delicious damson and berry fruit. Being rich and full bodied, it's also densely textured, with smoky touches of wood from barrel aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Château L'Escadre 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This rich wine is already smoothly textured yet still has fine tannins that give aging potential. With its black fruit and acidity, it's ripe, smoky and likely to be very drinkable from 2020.
title: Château Suau 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with its black-currant fruit and balanced sweet tannins. It has a fine elegant texture and juicy acidity. All these elements promise a wine that will be delicious to drink from 2019. The daughters of owners Bernadette Faure and Alain Aubert oversee vineyards, winemaking and marketing.
title: Château Hyot 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux
